39274457.review:
Llevo jugando la Saga de Unreal Tournament desde que tenia 3 años y puedo decir que no solo ha sido mi juego favorito desde la infancia si no que al pasar de los años no he podido dar con un juego mejor que UT2K4, el movimiento, el aim, el preaim o spam y la estrategia que ocupas para ganar al otro team es incomparable, tengo que decir que ningun otro juego se puede comparar a UT2K4 mas que Toxikk (inspirado en UT2K4). 


La comunidad es lo mas amigable del mundo y requiere meses e inclusive años de practica para poder nivelarte con la comunidad en general, ya que la mayoria de los que aun juegan son proplayers. Es un juego para gente que le encantan los e-sports de shooters.

Este juego es perfecto en su genero y unico al mismo tiempo, si me preguntaran que si lo recomiendo, no lo dudo, osea te diria es el mejor shooter jamas creado no solo de la saga de UT si no de toda la historia de los videojuegos en su genero. Esta joya no es para cualquier persona, si no para la gente tryhard y amante de los videojuegos.

38523600.review:
Игра детства, непонятная история, и просто шедевр.
В этой игре завязка мне не очень понятна, понятно только что события происходят после победы генерала в Unreal Tournament 2003(которую даже на uTorrent найти трудно). Нам показывают крутую заставку и предлагают выбрать режим.
-Мультиплеер. С ним всё просто: подключаетесь к серверу с нужным вам режимом и начинаете мясо, но там людей мало, остались только мега-хардкорщики которые все эти 13 лет не вылезали из UT.
-Одиночная кампания. Её разберём поподробнее. Вам предлагают выбрать персонажа после чего пройти несколько битв в режиме все против всех. В конце вы набираете команду по вкусу, цвету и параметрам после чего побеждаете(или нет) в битве с ними чтобы показать что вы достойны быть коммандиром. Затем вы проходите ряд уровней команда на команду и выходите на турнир, где встречаете такие режимы как двойное доминирование(удерживать контроль над 2мя точками одновременно), захват флага, если не ошибаюсь, бомбардировка, где вы носите специальное устройство в ворота врага(этакий футбол) и штурм, ряд миссий с мини-сюжетом где вы сначала выполняете задачи, потом мешаете их выполнить противнику, и наконец, получив все 4 кубка вы сражаетесь в финале за кубок нереального турнира. Миссий хватит на долго. А ещё транспорт есть.
-Одиночная игра. Если вам не хватило миссий или режимов в одиночной игре вы можете опробовать мутаторы, другие режимы и карты и прочее, прочее, прочее. Веселья хватит.
-Геймплей. Геймплей это лютое крошилово всех кто движется, разнообразие оружия позволит найти свой стиль и показать на что ты способен. Искусственный интелект даже на средней сложности показывает себя мощно и дает хороший отпор любым попыткам победить. Разнообразие персонажий позволяет игре предоставить болшее разнообразие вражеских команд, а значит вы можете проиграть раз, два, а затем вам попадётся крайне слабая или нетактичная команда и победа ваша, но от рандома тут мало что зависит, параметры не сильно колеблятся, а если одна команда проигрывала вам по точности, но выигрывала по тактике, то другая может проиграть по тактике и выйграть по той же агрессивности. Разнообразие оружия и сложностей так велико, что позавидует и Serious Sam. Так же упомяну графику, графика как бы вам не резали глаза скриншёты, намного приятнее, но сильно картинку не растянешь.

Если вам не режет глаз старая графика и вы любите устроить мясо - эта игра ваш выбор. А сейчас, в зимнюю распродажу за 60р можно вообще все части ухватить.

38406502.review:
in essence, UT2004 is essentially a souped up version of UT99. both are far from the same game, but the core gameplay and aspects that make a UT game Unreal are there: fast-paced arena-FPS action, fantastic graphics, thriving multiplayer and modbase, and of course a ton of maps and playermodels out there.

UT2004 brings a couple new things to the table outside of the new engine, specifically vehicles and new gamemodes. The physics are also a little different, which may turn off people used to UT99's physics.

despite its shortcomings, UT2004's still a worthy treat for FPS fans, and like UT99, is still very much worth a play today.

Plusy i minusy:

+ Grafika na pewno nie robi takiego wrażenia jak w chwili, gdy gra się ukazała (pamiętam, pomyślałem wtedy, że chyba nie można zrobić lepszej grafy; dzisiaj raczej jest lekkie "bleh", zwłaszcza w kwestii wyglądu postaci). Ale i tak nadal daje radę
+ Natomiast cała reszta, a zwłaszcza grywalność nadal wymiata. M.in. muzyka i dźwięk (zresztą w całej serii) mocno na plus.
+ Najlepsze co jest, to oczywiście mega-grywalność. Arenowych multi-strzelnek jest ofcoz mnóstwo, ale... Unreal to jednak Unreal!

- Na minus mała liczba ludzi grająca w multi
- Plus to, że można mieć zaatakowany komp przy wykorzystaniu tej gierki (aczkolwiek nie wersji na Steam akurat) i połączenia sieciowego, co mnie spotkało; na szczęście bez poważniejszych konsekwencji

Za ocenę niech posłuży fakt, że kupiłem sobie tę grę na Steamie, mimo że mam ją także w wersji nie-Steamowej. Wszystkie trzy odsłony Unreal Tournament są nadal świetne i rządzą!

37810463.review:
Sadece döneminin değil, serinin efsanesi.

Demo ile ısındığım bu zalımın oyununun bende çok hatırası vardır. Ve ben de dahil olmak üzere, her 10 UT oynayan oyunculardan en az 8'i bu oyunun serinin en iyisi olduğunu size  söyleyecektir.

Grafilk olarak belki kimilerine göre döneminin efsanesi olmayabilir, fakat oynayışı açısından, özellikle double dodge/çift sıçrama ve fizik kurallarının altını üstünü getiren oyun yapısı ( [i] Quake'e selam Unreal'a devam :P [/i] ) sayesinde döneminin genç hayranlarını sevdirmeyi başarmıştı Epic Games. Şu anda ismi anıldığı zaman ,belki evli-mutlu-çocuklu olan, UT oyuncularının gözlerinde bir tutam yaş damlası bile dökebilir bu oyun.

Oyunda Assault (AS) (takımlardan birinin görevleri yerine getirerek (saldırı) diğerinin bu görevleri yapmasına engel olduğu (savunma) takım oyunu), Onslaught (ONS) ( amaç Power node ele geçirerek rakibin Power Core'unu yok etmek) , Capture The Flag (CTF) (bayrak ele geçirme), Bombing Rounds (yarı Amerikan futboluna yarı basketbola benzetebiliriz) ve elbette Death Match(DM) ve Team Death Match (TDM) modları yer alıyor. Her birinin oyunculara verdiği zevk ise paha biçilemez.

Favorilerim Canyon ve Mothership (AS); Rankin (DM), Torlan (ONS), Facing Worlds (CTF) ve Collossus (BR) u oynamadan geçmeyin derim. 

Quake hayranları belki bu oyun için [i] çakma Quake [/i] diyebilir, ama eğer ki ben Quake'e bir gün başlarsam, bu UT 2004 sayesindedir.

37458206.review:
Only played enough here to make the review, since I also own a version on GOG. I've played this game to hell and back, unmodded and also loaded with tons of customs skins, models and maps.
Assault mode has some of the best maps of any FPS game out there, period. Bots can be stupidly easy or hard to an unfair level, with plenty of options inbetween (I start having considerable trouble against Adept level bots). Weapons are well balanced and most of them are fun to use in some manner or another, since nearly every weapon has a secondary fire. Movement is frantic and fast, and can be even faster if you use a mutator. Every mode has more than one map that is incredibly fun to play and instantly memorable, unlike nearly every other FPS where 90% of all matches happen in the same map.
The original modes that shipped with the game were Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch, Invasion (survive against waves of enemies, something that Epic really made better with Gears of War), Capture the Flag, Bombing Run (kinda like american football), Double Domination, Assault and Onslaught.
The sheer amount of content from this game puts more recent games to shame. And the soundtrack is made of pure awesome, to boot!
Even after 13 years, this game can still be looked upon as one that did many things right. It deserves every bit of praise it gets.

Getting custom skins and maps is a real chore nowadays, with beyondunreal and skincity pretty much dead. Gamer-lab.com and utzone.de still host some stuff, so try looking there! And if ut.rushbase.net/beyondunreal/skincity/ut2k4 ever comes online, check it, too!

Для нас это была идеальная игра! Додж+двойной прыжок - они уникальны! Нигде такого больше нет. Наилучшая из возможных, где именно от тебя и твоей скорости (а не сраного рандома с разбросом пуль) зависело всё. Долбились мы с другом просто до усрачки. Godlik'и в дуэли со мной всегда уходили в минуса (неинтересно, бееее!) Наше всё - сервера playgrounds, куда и российские чемпионы частенько захаживали. Любопытно, но товарищи из сборной играли хуже, чем лидеры Playgrounds (Carnagin, Reveleation, Exz.slipi). Это были товарищи ААА класса. Например, я лично видел, как слипи с 1!!! % сделал killing spree! И когда их поимеешь (скажем так, мой уровень был А, но не их ААА) .... Поиметь кого-то из этой троицы было всё равно, что в боевом спарринге дрюкнуть тренера. В этот момент твой .!. увеличивался в разы. Может быть, то же было бы и с Полосатым, но он заходил в игру не так часто, и мы почти не пересекались.
       Блин, какие комбинации были. На Flux'е за кватом через додж-прыжок. А во всем известном другом зале вообще тактически можно было прыгать на аренее через додж-прыжок-Wall jump. Ах, оружие! Спермомёт, Lightning gun (точно в глаз), тактический flack, шоковое ружьё (мастера расстреливали шары просто произвольно). Прикиньте - запускает пару шаров в толпу. Ппока летят, с километра мухе в глаз через себя в падении со снайперки, дальше тактически выбрызгивает со спермомёта порцию под ноги назло наседающим врагам, а потом точечно на подлёте к стенам и с учётом постоянного передвижения взрывает шары.... Арррр. 
       А поддержка EAX! Если у вас наушники аудиофильского класса (как у меня), то просто по звуку точно знаешь, где бродит враг. (Не бродит - умопомрачительно носится).

ААА. I Cum!!!! 

UT 2004 - это 10 из 10 !!!! Непревзойдённый гениальный шедевр!!

36686240.review:
I started playing Unreal Tournament 2004 a long-ass time ago, then kinda stopped, and then a couple days ago started again and beat it. It's mostly identical to Unreal Tournament, a game I really like, so fittingly I also really like this. I don't like it quite as much, though, for the reasons outlined below.

The main new things that UT2004 has are new gamemodes and thingies based around the expanded team mechanics. You can now pick your team members, they have different stats, and you can assign them different roles in different matches. That's all well and good, but this means that there are almost no free-for-all deathmatches, which is a shame.

There's also a new engine, with all new graphics. I'm sure this was revolutionary at the time, but now it just looks unremarkably mid-2000s, while I actually still kinda like Unreal Tournament's distinct, low-poly models.

There's now an Adrenaline system, which is kinda useful sometimes. Also, there's a persistent money mechanic, which alternates between being completely pointless and annoying because the game will just take some away or make you gamble with it.

But overall, my main issue with UT2004—the one that makes it worse than UT for me—is its feel. It's just floatier and less kinetic, which really takes something away. There's none of Unreal Tournament's raw, impactful energy, and as a result it's just significantly less fun to play. I still recommend it, but really you should buy Unreal Tournament '99 first.

36093849.review:
Грустно на такие игры смотреть.


UT 2004 был пиком серии, добившемся наибольшей популярности. Даже в стартовом варианте игра предлагала непривычное разнообразие для шутера, а невероятно креативное комьюнити с большой скоростью начало создавать огромное количество контента.

День за днем, неделя за неделей "сыпалось" все: от режимов боя, до скинов; от новых видов оружия и карт, до тотальных конверсий, полностью меняющих правила и даже модов изменяющих жанр!


Есть у игры проблемы? Только одна - время.

Время безжалостно. Запуск старого мультиплеерного хита - это как посещение "мертвого" города. Дома все еще стоят, в них есть окна, по улицам проложены дороги, только нет людей, нет жизни.

А установка модов к старому мультиплеерному хиту - это строительство и обустройство коттеджа рядом с таким городом.

Я отдаю дань уважения разработчикам за замечательную игру, я отдаю дань уважения сообществу за их креативность и трудолюбие. Но я не рекомендую к покупке и трате времени. То же относится и к первой и к третьей части - может в них еще кто-то играет и даже создает для них контент, но время их давно ушло.


Что касается UT4 - делается она настолько черепашьими темпами, что рискует никогда не выйти из альфы, но поиграть можно уже сейчас, кстати бесплатно.)

34168108.review:
I've been playing this game since it came out 13 years ago, and it still rocks.

Unlike (the majority of) modern shooters, it has a fully working map building capability, and there are still a huge number of places to get FREE additional maps, vehicles and characters to add and play with to add real longevity to the gaming experience.  Contrast  that with the modern world of pay DLC, maps costing more than the original game, and limited user input, you see what a barren, sterile world modern games can be, but I digress...

There are no classes for characters, so you are all free to blast away equally, but the maps are clever and engaging, and the bots intelligence is easily good enough to be a challenge.

If you have grown up on consoles and COD, you might find this lacking in story depth and graphics detail, many calling it "old school", but the playability is first class, and is a great pick up and blast away game that holds its own a generation after it first made its debut.

34106691.review:
Completely new to the Unreal series myself, and to shooters in general. Bought this game mainly because a good friend plays it. That said, I like the wide range of characters one can play, which is a lot more then the earlier games since villains are playable now as well. 

Really like the wide range of bot strength, from as simple that a complete noob like me has a fun challange and can progress well up to near impossible that I imagine can cater any die-hard shooter fan. Haven't tried multiplayer yet so I can't say anything useful about it.

Another nice thing to see is that there is quite a bit of backstory of the characters and arena worlds available, but presented as texts in the menu so those that want to delve into the story behind everything can do so, while those that don't care can simply choose not to bother with it. 

Gameplay is nice and fluid for me, playing this on a laptop with an AMD A6 5350M APU, with 6gb ram and windows 10.
Haven't tried any modifications or cheats if those are available.

33186844.review: UT 99 was my first shooter purchase when i bought my original comp, had loads of fun with it. So, when Epic announced that 2004 was going to be the next Ut, there was plenty of excitement. At first, there was a large number of ppl who didn't like the new version, myself included. The huge amount of content including many different game types, the single player campaign, the new and improved weapons, everything meshed together to create one of the best all time arena shooters. I prefer this one even over the upcoming new one. The multiplayer isnt near as populated as it used to be, But the single player game is as fun as ever and adding bots to your own server is easy. so, i  still i come back to this title time and time again. Hours indicated isn't hours actually played. I still have the original cd's so most of my time was spent utilizing those.  10/10 for one of the great arena shooters.

*Starts playing 13 years later*
*Sucks at the game*
*Still plays on Experienced*
*Qualifies for the tournament*
*Get some good and bad games in*
*20/10*
Seriously though, even though this game's multiplayer is kinda dead, it's still fun to play the tournament mode, and mess around in the practice mode, "Instant Action". Has a good amount of weapons, and maps. The modding community is great. Ez to mod. Has different movement options. Isn't your average FPS. The graphics still hold up for 2004. I highly recommend if you want a fresh experience from an old game. Better than Quake 2 and 3 tbh. And thanks to Epic keeping the servers up, you can still play with your friends. The game does have a learning curve to it, but you'll be fine if you're a casual player. Fun for both casual and competitive players. Highly recommended for LAN parties with your friends (if you have any do to this game). Buy it.

La primera vez que jugué al Unreal Tournament 2004 fue en el año 2005, ni siquiera era mío. El que sí tenía era el Unreal Tournament 2003. Ésta es una versión más completa de su precuela, con más armas, más mapas, más personajes, la misma jugabilidad.

Incluso con una PC no tan poderosa el juego funciona de maravilla, si te gustan los FPS del tipo arena (estilo Quake por ejemplo), lo recomiendo completamente.

El único detalle que por lo menos me generó disconformidad es que en el modo Campaña, tenés un menú limitado de personajes a elegir, puede que aquel que quieras usar no esté disponible para dicho modo. Aprovechenlo en estas ofertas.

I really wish I could recommend it in 2017.

Servers are mostly dead, and those with the well modded fun maps of my past are poorly (by that I mean overly) administered by server hosts. The culture of the game wasn't as it was. But that's probably due to the cohort of people who can only run games from about 2004.

32508407.review:
In my opinion, this is the definitive tournament shooter out there. The sequel, Unreal Tournament 3, was decent but the developers seemingly focused on extracting the best visuals from the Unreal engine and sacrificed on features and gameplay. Then of course there was Quake 3 which was awesome in its own right but just didn't seem to have as much to do.

My only complaint about this game is the lack of modern resolution support. You will need to manually edit a configuration file in order to play with widescreen resolutions. This isn't a problem and is a one time fix per installation but still...if there was ever a game in need of a 'remastered' version, this is it.

The legendary Unreal AI makes another appearance and doesn't fail to impress. You have a good dozen or so difficulty choices so the single player mode can provide a proper challenge for just about anyone out there.

As I mentioned above, the gameplay and features are second to none in the 'tournament shooter' genre. You have your classic deathmatch and team deathmatch modes. You have capture the flag and vehicle combat. You have node capturing styles of play like that made famous by the Battlefield series. There are some other gameplay modes that may be more unique to Unreal but my overall favorite is the "football" style mode in which you can either jump/fall through the goal with the ball for 6 points or fire the ball through the goal from afar for 3 points. Truly unique.

This game is old but gold.

It has issues running on Windows 10 at the moment. 
To fix the problem do the following (as originally commented by Steam user "tacobob", but I can confirm, this DOES fix the issue)

Go to 
C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Unreal Tournament 2004\System
and look for and open UT2004.ini

Find the section with the below entries:

[Engine.Engine]
RenderDevice=D3D9Drv.D3D9RenderDevice
;RenderDevice=D3D9Drv.D3D9RenderDevice
;RenderDevice=Engine.NullRenderDevice
;RenderDevice=OpenGLDrv.OpenGLRenderDevice
;RenderDevice=PixoDrv.PixoRenderDevice

Replace the "D3D9Drv.D3D9RenderDevice" on the first line with "OpenGLDrv.OpenGLRenderDevice" (without quotes)

It'll look like this:

[Engine.Engine]
RenderDevice=OpenGLDrv.OpenGLRenderDevice
;RenderDevice=D3D9Drv.D3D9RenderDevice
;RenderDevice=Engine.NullRenderDevice
;RenderDevice=OpenGLDrv.OpenGLRenderDevice
;RenderDevice=PixoDrv.PixoRenderDevice

31360465.review:
[h1]"Unreal Tournament 2004 is a multiplayer first person shooter that combines the kill-or-be-killed experience of gladiatorial combat with cutting-edge technology."[/h1]

Да, все верно, Unreal Tornament 2004 года - одна из тех классик жанра, которые стоит проиграть. Игра жанра "убей или будешь убит" заключается в том, что тебе нельзя стоять на месте. Здесь не по кемперишь, не походишь в присядку (хотя боты умудряются) и нет времени осматривать достопримечательности местной карты. Игра предлагает широкий спектр всевозможных режимов игры, например, Assault, где надо выполнить цепочку квестов по захвату объекта или наоборот уничтожения. В игре есть и собственная кампания, которая хоть и не к месту, но сделана очень хорошо.

    [tr]
        [th]Плюсы[/th]

    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Графика[/td]

    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Гемплей[/td]
        [td]Старый Unreal. Про гемплей говорить нечего. [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Звуковое сопровождение[/td]
        [td]Музыка здесь высший класс. На "бурных" картах она активна, в космосе - спокойна.[/td]
    [/tr]
[tr] [td] Комьюнити[/td]
[td]В своё время, а особенно сейчас, игра продолжает поддерживаться комьюнити. Выпускаются карты, новые циклы квестов для Assault, много скинов для игроков и оружия. Игра жива!
[/td] 
[/tr]
[/table]

[table]
    [tr]
        [th]Минусы[/th]
        [th]Описание[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Сейчас[/td]
        [td]К сожалению, игра довольно плохо выглядит на современных устройствах. Имеют места баги. Это не совсем минус, игра очень старая, но стоит это отметить.[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]
Одна из лучших игр за всю историю, совершенно заслуженно.

29836558.review:
Played the Unreal series since 99. No moddern FPS can even compare to this: the Michelangelo of games. At the time, I'd also played Quake, Doom, and CS. But Unreal....oh my, Unreal. My first true love. She snuffed out all others like candles in the rain.

Every gamer has that one game that just consumes them. Their pulse quickens and their eyes plaster to the screen, your very soul trapped in an enigma of endless time. Years pass as you watch you life fly by at 60 HZ. Your wrists build strong lasting muscle and hardened tendons from hammering on the WASD keys for hours on end. Your index and middle fingers become your future wifes dream toys as you hone your dexterity with years of mousebutton rappid firing. Your heart races as you shotgun dance with your enemies states and countries apart.
This game....
This game needs no introduction. It's name is simple and rightfully fitting: Unreal.
In it's prime, there were thousands of servers on Game Spy. Close your eyes and point, you'd find one packed with dozens of players from all over the globe. My personal favorite was Instagib (one shot kills). CTF, or TDM. I played in a clan that utilized a player built map system called "giant maps". They were maps that looked like your living room, kitchen, dining room, dorm room, bathroom, etc... but you were the size of a penny. 20 guys buzzing around looking like red or blue dots againt a refridgerator or television. "BigPapa290" is strafing on the floor by the door stop, dodging lasers from an onslaught of enemies flying over the cookie jar. Your clan noob "SparklesTheElephant" is straight walking along the bathroom tiles, still figuring out the controls and somehow lands some lucky shot on your enemies veteran "X-L4X69" who's stalking him from the toilet paper dispenser. "DarkCarnage49" is camped up on the shelf by the fabric softener sniping guys off by the furnace pilot light, but "DeepDishPizza" teleports up from the floor in some crazy zig-zag pattern and an epic battle ensues as they jump and double jump and spin back and fourth until one lands a shot. Then, somehow you've found your way into the clothes dryer drum where there is no wall and everywhere is a mirror. There's no telling which way is out. "HabaneroFarts" has also stumbled upon this trap! Son of a B****! In a fury, you start firing at ghosts. Did I hit him? No, that was his reflection. Why isn't he dead?! How the F*** do I get out of this hell!
So you just stand still, hopefully he can just end your misery and you can just die and spawn in the kitty litter box like you were hoping for to begin with.
GREAT SCOTT! the memories :)
I really doubt you could find games in Unreal that are like this today, but nevertheless, all other game modes are just as fun. This game, is one of 2 game that gets my full 10/10. It consumed my life, man. And I loved every minute of it.

I have been playing this game since I was a wee lad. It is still a go-to for my friends and I to play when we get together for a LAN. Fast-paced action, awesome arsenal of weapons, some unique like the link gun and bio rifle, others staples such as the rocket launcher, beautifully detailed environments that still hold up to this day, and various game modes such as deathmatch, capture the flag, and other unique modes that involve controlling different points or completing objectives. The "onslaught" game mode is particularly fun, sporting massive outdoor maps, and land and air vehicles - but nothing beats some good old-fashioned deathmatch or CTF. 

There is pretty much nothing I dislike about this game. It's fast, it's fun, and blowing up your friends as you run through their base with their flag never gets old. 

I prefer this installment over Unreal Tournament 3 and the new one that is in alpha. It still stands up today as a prolific arena shooter, in my opinion. 

10/10.

29412682.review:
Adds to what made the first Unreal Tournament a masterpiece.
Based mostly on the GOG.com (DRM-free) version and Unreal Anthology (DVD ROM).

When making a sequel to the much venerated Unreal Tournament (1999) you better damn well get it right. Fortunately for both Epic and UT fans, Unreal Tournament 2004 does precisely that. Taking the misteps out of Unreal Tournament 2003 and adding some cool new features paid off in spades for Epic and UT fans.

This time around, UT looks dazzling - even in 2017. Deathmath, Team Deathmatch, Capture the Flag, Dominiation, and Assault all make comebacks. Domination has a noticable difference in that teams must control TWO check points simultaneously for a few seconds as opposed to multiple check points at any given time. Added to the modes is Onslaught, which involves controling nodes until the opposing team's core is exposed. Both Assault and Onslaught now utilize huge environments and...VEHICLES. Removed is the option to have four teams at once (R/B/G/Y) in TDM and DOM. From the obvious graphical enhancement, which has aged quite well, to the varied gameplay, UT2004 delivers.

While Unreal Tournament 99/GOTY is my all-time fave FPS, UT2004 slides in right behind it for some damn good reasons.

For those wondering where UT2003 went: it's all in UT2004, minus some parts that put fans off. In fact, there's a Mutator that allows for using the UT2003 HUD. So UT2003 is in UT2004.

[i]Remember when games, back in the days, let you customize your matches/lobbies any way you wanted and included AI bots that are not only smart, but also challenging? Pepperidge farm remembers![/i]
Regardless of its age, Unreal Tournament 2004 (a.k.a. UT2004) still remains one of the greatest and most competitive FPS games of all time (along with the other entries in the series). Still works well on modern systems without any tweaking necessary.

+ UT2004 is a fast-paced and chaotic game where accuracy and awareness are the main requisite to "frag like it's 1999", also thanks to a wide range of guns that are different from each other and have both primary and secondary firing modes.
+ The 2004 edition is an UT game at its core while still adding many new features and gamemodes, for example Onslaught, which gives the game a "Battlefield 2" approach with vehicular combat and nodes to capture on huge maps. The old Assault gamemode from the first game in the series has also been improved thanks to less linear levels and vehicles.
+ While the vanilla game has lots of content and variety on its own, the still-active modding community offers so much more (for example, important mods to mention which have then turned into stand-alone games like the wave-based Killing Floor and WW2 shooter Red Orchestra).
+ This game is multiplayer-centered. You can host listen servers with port forwarding required if you want to play with friends, or host dedicated ones, but even offline it offers a great experience: bots are human-like, they work on all gamemodes and you can choose from many difficulty options for them, along with more customization options.

Well worth the purchase, wether you're an online or offline player!

28553918.review: 虚幻竞技场系列当之无愧是FPS历史上的里程碑，甚至可称为一代宗师。在那个年代，CS、雷神之锤、虚幻竞技场构成了一个三足鼎立的局面，UT2004将这个系列带到了一个新的高峰。想想看，在当时的大环境下一个将近6G容量的游戏带给我们的是什么样的震撼！CS意味着一个时代的开始，而虚幻竞技场却开创了FPS的未来。今天我们熟知的夺点征服模式，入侵模式，抢夺模式，职业养成，哪怕是后来DOTA中的连杀配音都是源自于这个系列。它让我们了解到FPS不仅是枪与枪，勇与智的对决，更是带给了FPS玩家一个全新的战斗模式和体验。在当年为数不多的有国内代理发行的大作中，虚幻竞技场系列堪称无冕之王。而童年记忆中那些69、48、38这些数字便代表着我们对这些大作最坚定的支持。

28540171.review:
It's mainly a multiplayer first person shooter, but because it came out in 2004 the multiplayer community is unfortunately mostly dead.

There is a single player mode that consists of organized botmatches. You can form your own team of AI controlled bots and lead them to victory. Some of the maps have really inspired design and layout. For example there's one map where you're in a starfighter and you have to fight your way into a massive enemy mothership. Once inside you continue to progress on foot past numerous defenses. You finally make it to the enemy reactor core and blow it up, destroying the mothership. Awesome!

My main complaint about the bots is that there's very little variety in their behavior. Once you've figured out one bot you've figured out all of them. This hurts the replayability of the single player mode.

There's a huge variety of variant game types to keep things fresh. Everything from "instagib" (one shot kills) deathmatches to classic Capture the Flag. 

There's also an adrenaline "booster" system; you earn or collect adrenaline points as you fight on a map. Once you reach 100 points you can use a special booster ability. Unfortunately how to use the booster system isn't well documented in the game, and many of the boosts aren't terribly useful. Also I found the boosts to be difficult to trigger at times, especially in the middle of an intense firefight, as you need to press a combination of keys in rapid succession.

The music is unobstrusive and nothing special. Graphics were probably cutting edge in 2004 but today they're just passable.

It's hard to recommend paying full price for a mainly multiplayer game with no multiplayer community. It might be worth getting on sale to play through the single player mode once, because as stated earlier some of the maps are really innovative.

28428147.review:
[h1]12 игровых режимов, плюс многочисленные моды, да это же как целый сборник игр![/h1]

Доступные режимы (ограничение на размер руководства не позволяет их описать):
* [b]Deathmatch[/b]
* [b]Last Man Stading[/b]
* [b]Mutant[/b]
* [b]Team Deathmatch[/b]
* [b]Capture the Flag[/b]
* [b]Instagib Capture the Flag[/b]
* [b]Vehicle Capture the Flag[/b] (доступен только в Join game)
* [b]Double Domination[/b]
* [b]Bombing Run[/b]
* [b]Onslaught[/b]
* [b]Assault[/b]
* I[b]nvansion[/b]
Режимов из Ludicrous Edition нет.

[b]Плюсы:[/b]
+ Большой набор очень хорошо проработанных карт, для отличающихся режимов сделаны разные карты. Особо стоит отметить карты 1 на 1.
+ Девять видов основного оружия, три оружия доступных на картах с техникой и все эти двенадцать пушек имеют основной и дополнительный режим. Нету бесполезного оружия, в бою обычно используется сразу несколько пушек, в зависимости от дистанции до врага и ситуации (разве что Assault Rifle слабовато). Также есть 3 супер-оружия отличающихся огромным уроном и областью поражения, имеют только один заряд и спамятся очень медленно в скрытых местах.
+ Подвижность игрока. Двойной прыжок, хороший контроль игрока в воздухе, рывки, отскоки от стен, благодаря этому профессиональный игрок может играть сразу против нескольких новичков и ни разу не погибнуть.
+ Не отвлекающее, а настраивающее на геймплей музыкальное сопровождение. В случае, если вам не понравится музыка, есть встроенный плеер, где можно составить свой личный трек лист.
+ Адреналин комбо, поощряющее активных игроков. За убийства, продолжение серии убийств и выполнение целей карты игрок получает адреналин (так же его можно подбирать на карте), собрав 100/100 можно активировать временное комбо (увеличение скорости передвижения, регенерация, частичная невидимость, ...). 
+ Боты с восьмью сложностями, способные оказать достойное сопротивление и слушающие команды игрока.
+ "Мутаторы" для настройки карт, можно сделать чтобы на карте было только один тип оружия, увеличить головы игроков, изменить скорость игры, ...
+ Если вы не знаете карты, то нажав N и M, вам покажут ближайший путь до вашей цели и цели игрока.

[b]Минусы:[/b]
 Как таковых минусов я не вижу, разве что некоторым моделям игрока сложнее нацелиться в голову и на карте Irondust есть место, где можно пролезть под текстуру и через неё стрелять.


В своё время, когда под руку попались диски с этой игрой, я сразу забыл про все остальные шутеры и играл только в анриал, так ещё и купил в стиме. Игра старая, но не устаревшая, так что, хотя бы, по скидке можно купить для ознакомления )

 Моды можно скачать тут > http://www.moddb.com/games/unreal-tournament-2004/mods

Saga Unreal, lembro até hoje o primeiro contato que tive com um jogo da série — Unreal Tournament 99. Tinha 12 anos na época, e foi também meu primeiro jogo de FPS. Horas e mais horas gastas jogando contra os bots (sim, tinha a versão pirata, mas também naquela época a internet era discada então...)

Jogava todos os modos de jogo; meu preferido, porém, era "The last man standing" — "O último homem em pé". Um modo que cada jogador tinha uma quantidade determinada de vidas. O objetivo do jogo era matar seus inimigos, quem tivesse as vidas zerada ficava fora do jogo. O último jogador que sobrava ganhava a partida (meio óbvio se for julgar pelo nome kkkk)

Lembro-me perfeitamente de todos os sentimentos que tive na época que eu jogava o modo campanha e tinha que enfrentar o chefão chamado Xan. Mais de uma semana tentando ganhar dele, foi um sofrimento terrível acompanhado de raiva, estresse, e por fim felicidade quando eu finalmente consegui derrotá-lo. Bons tempos!

Passe-se alguns anos e jogo pela primeira vez o UT2004. Esse foi o auge... Comparado ao UT99, no UT2004 eu gastei o triplo de horas ou mais só jogando com os bots kkkkkk e sem falar que eu reservava alguns dias só pra ficar pesquisando e baixando Mods e Mutators pro jogo (no UT99 também, esqueci de ressaltar isso no começo hehe), era incrível! Me bateu até um sentimento de nostalgia enquanto escrevia essa análise!

Ao contrário do UT99, não liguei muito pro modo campanha do UT2004, embora eu tenha salvado... Foi só capricho mesmo. 

Comprem, vale muito a pena. Seus centavos serão muito bem gastos kkkk

Ровно как и 99, 2004 - это бессменная классика. Хотите больший мультиплеерных побоищ с техникой и ядерными ударами, их есть тут. Хотите камерных дуэлей со сложным АИ, и их есть тут. 26191246.review:
[h1]12年之后，虚幻竞技场2004依旧是最佳竞技场式FPS游戏[/h1]
欢迎来到武器不需要上弹的世界。
WIN 7、WIN 10无运行问题，唯一比较尴尬的是游戏并不支持1080分辨率。

[h1]依旧好玩的游戏模式[/h1]
单人战役提供了很好的游戏入门，玩家将作为UT的参赛者，一路过关斩将杀入决赛。
组建自己的队伍，出任小队长，夺取小奖杯，走上人生巅峰。

多人游戏模式繁多，从推进式的进攻模式，再到战地式的征服模式，
更有橄榄球、夺旗 以及 Killing floor的前身————侵略模式。

进攻模式我推荐母舰和垃圾场这两张地图，非常好玩。

但在12年以后的今天，大多数情况我们只能开个bot进行游戏。
但即使如此，也依旧好玩。

[h1]武器&载具[/h1]
我最喜欢的武器是连接枪 （可以把敌人烧成骨头）
我最喜欢的载具是毒蝎越野车 （左右两侧的刃片可以把人砍成两段）

[h1]UT2004的延续[/h1]
既有dota从这里借去了经典的连杀语音，
也有killing floor以mod起家，最后成功变成独立系列。

[h1]杂项[/h1]
游戏提供了超过80名角色并配有角色简介。
但别忘了UT2004众多的角色mod，可以轻松让游戏角色突破100+

同样，依靠mod，地图超多。 好像steam版的UT2004，已经添加了一些优秀的mod图进去。
进攻模式多了四张地图。

[u]如果epic以UE4完全重制这款作品的话，肯定能大卖。[/u]

10/10  [u]所以我们发现其实十几年来游戏没怎么变。[/u]

26181152.review: Classic FPS, with a very good game engine which is well optimized. I remember playing it on my old computer, it was a garbage, still it ran the game well. The maps are wonderfully made, with amazing effects. There are several gamemodes, from which the Assault and Onslaught are my favourites, but other gamemodes are still fun. There is plenty weapons to choose from, which are very different from each other in handling, also vehicles are included in some gamemodes. The single player is very well made, the campaign is long and full of action. The graphics and the sound are also very good for it's time. I highly recommend this game for players who love FPS, but don't have a very good PC.

26068531.review:
Вот не знаю почему, но именно на этой части у меня не получилось обрыдаться от ностальгии. А ведь когда-то (осподя, сколько лет назад это было?! 0_о) я играл в нее с бооооольшим удовольствием. И в UT2003, и в UT2004. Мне нравилось собирать свои комманды отморозков, вместе идти к славе. И, конечно, особый фан доставляли сетевые баталии. Все это было. Но не сегодня. 

Сейчас игра скорее раздражает, чем радует. Это, наверное, тру хардкор, но поведение ботов вымораживает. На легкой сложности играть скучно, на серьезной - невозможно :) Особенно во всякие межгалактические баскетболы. Соперники играют как про, а твои боты-сопартийцы - как дауны. Сетевая игра тоже превратилась в какой-то треш. Редкие олдфаги продолжают зaдротить игру, и случайно зашедший на огонек игрок им, конечно, не соперник )) Порвут и высушат. А попадешь в команду таких же нубасов как ты сам, играть опять же скучно. Все-таки современный мультиплеер избаловал, хочется чего-то большего. 

Зато есть коллекционные карточки. Неожиданно для такого динозавра. 

Был бы нейтральный отзыв, поставил бы его. А так, звиняйте, Thumb down. Ну не могу я такое рекомендовать, даже из самых светлых ностальгических чувств. Лучше уж тогда оригинальный UT поставьте. Мне лично, это почему-то куда больше фана принесло. Хотя все равно... Все уже не то и не так, как когда-то...

25527013.review:
When it comes to mind-less FPS violence, I can’t believe people would rather play mediocre games such as CoD when they could just go with legendary classics such as this game. I’m a huge fan of this game, I’ve played it for YEARS, I’ve even been on tournaments of this game and even won two of those. However, I’m gonna try to leave that aside and give you a proper review of why you should or not buy this game, and as usual I will start with the negative parts of it. 

...Or I would if this game had much negative stuff. Really, the only negative stuff I can think off have to be Assault maps, as they deviate too much from the other game-modes, and vehicle based maps can be a little weird at times. And maybe that it's multiplayer community isn't that full of people after more than 10 years after release. That’s it!

Instead, what does this game have that it’s good?

First and foremost, the AI. It’s good. It’s really f#cking good. In fact I’m an expert at bugging and breaking games, and rarely I’ve found the AI breaking and falling apart. The game also has the option to put a random difficulty mode and then analyze how well you do against it, then constantly change it so it’s all up to your skill level, something that I don’t think I’ve seen in other games and should be in most of them.

Going right up to that are the maps. Not even one of them feels the same as others, only a few of them grow a bit stale because of them being too big or too small and sh#t like that. The game also has maps from previous games that are memorable, such as Facing Worlds, which is the De_Dust of Unreal Tournament, and even adding remakes and different versions of them.

Another big-#ss point in favor of the game has to be the soundtrack. I ain’t f#cking arround when I say, IT’S REALLY F#CKING GOOD. The devs knew what they needed to make the action feel even more intense, and succeeded immensely. 

The gameplay itself is also kind of a master-piece, a one of it’s kind in FPS games. All guns (except the ones to start with) are useful in their own way and have their own flair to themselves. They all have their own ways of being used and are all fun to waste people with, although some need more aim than others, such as the Lightning-Gun/Sniper Rifle and Shock Rifle. And hell, any game that has an Anti-Air weapon turned into a shotgun with a grenade launcher option has to be a great game on paper.

Something that’s also rather unique to this kind of game are the sprees, and the game announcer on it’s own. You know how in these modern fps crap games you get rewards for killing multiple people on a single life? Well f#ck that, here instead you get to hear insane voice clips from the announcer not believing how could you just do what to a human being. From the classic “KILLING SPREE!” to the infamous “HOLY SHIT!”, they’re all memorable. Also, the game keeps track of what you do in a match, and hitting F3 will show you information about it, such as how sh#t your aim is or how many sprees you got in that match.

All and all, is this game worth it?  Did you even pay any attention? Of course it is. It’s WAY superior to the sequel it got later on, which kinda sucked, and it has really good mod support. Infact, games such as Red Orchestra and Killing Floor started as mods for Unreal Tournament 2004, it’s that good. I seriously recommend it to any FPS fan out there who just wants to chill out and have fun murdering anything that f#cking moves. And if you want, install the Bloddy Hell mod, which makes, between a ton of other crap, blood and gore more sadistic and makes it stay on the map forever if you feel so, which is BLODDY F#CKING GREAT. 

TL;DR Edition: A classic FPS that never seems to age. F#cking good and cheap. If you like FPS and you don’t have it, you have serious issues either in your brain or your wallet.

25311397.review:
The 26.6 hours on my account is only a fraction of the time I've spent playing unreal tournament 2004.
I had a physical copy on release, and the game of the year edition as well.
I must of clocked in 1000's of hours in this game in my life.

This game is so much more than when you get in the box.
And what you get right out of the box is,
10 game modes.
Vehicles.
Mutators and built in game mods.
over 100 maps.
17 weapons, all with a secondary fire.
32 character models.

That right there is the content of 10 triple A titles released today, followed by years of shoddy paid dlc, all in one game on release.

They literally don't make them like this anymore.

The game itself has a wide community of modders, and even though most have moved on at this point, the mods still exist for download on many websites.

This is the game that incepted Killing Floor, Red Orchestra, and Alien swarm, all of which used to be conversions of UT2004, which you can still download the originals of course.

The gameplay is tight and still holds up today with the wall jumping, corner skiing, sliding, rocket jumps, ect.

24838585.review:
现在讲讲我是怎么被这款游戏潜移默化洗脑成暴黑的。可怜暴雪无辜躺枪。
咱不是什么骨灰级玩家，年龄也不大，什么德总 毁灭 雷神以前一概没接触过，为啥，那时候不光年龄小，而且方圆几里地能见到的电脑只有村里中学寥寥几台，教学用机嘛，只有这个东西可以玩（随便盗个图）：http://img.blog.163.com/photo/RqVikjA_G3TgA02FxF16UQ==/352406670842894822.jpg
貌似初中的时候吧，又一次去一个表哥家里，看见他玩《魔兽争霸3》。当时没见过世面，感觉这游戏真是神作。然而转折点立马就来了。我哥说，好玩吧，这里还有更好玩的。没错，它就是《虚幻竞技场2004》。上手玩的自然是本作特色，Onslaught猛攻模式。跟BOT切磋了几局，顿时两眼绿光：卧槽这才是最屌的游戏啊，war3是什么破玩意！虽然当时EPIC和BLZ的名号都不知道，但是暴黑的种子已经在心里落下了……如果当时先玩的是《生化危机3》，估计现在就是卡社一生黑了，呵呵呵呵。就这样，在亲戚家里蹭了几天，沉迷虚幻不能自拔，直到被父母拎了回去。当时我家也有电脑了，我还搞了个盗版碟，然而老爷机并带不动。虚幻2引擎就是牛逼啊！
后来上了大学，被好友带进Steam坑，当然，很多好友在玩《Dota2》，我也跟风尝试了一下。被电脑拿到一血后，“First Blood”的配音骤然响起。卧槽我没听错吧？我没听错吧？我没听错吧？“Killing Spree！”“Unstoppable”“MMMMMMMMONSTER KILL！！！”还有恢复、双倍伤害，闪烁匕首+原力法杖+掘地穿刺多重跳跃突袭，神似Shock Rifle的冰晶爆轰，跟Onslaught一样推塔拆家的核心玩法（虽然这个塔是要摧毁而不是占领的），真是热泪纵横啊！难怪VALVE开发Dota2之前买下了UT2004的mod《异星虫群》，难怪Icefrog找上专门开发射击游戏的VALVE，难怪坊间盛传IF与UT04的声优是好友……Unreal，DotA，VALVE，STEAM，一脉相承啊，War3编辑器只是个躯壳，DotA之魂，终究是FPS的！
再后来一次促销，猛然在首页发现了这个多年未曾谋面的U字徽标。想不到Steam上居然还有这个游戏！还废什么话！不买不是人！弗兰克加农炮，利维坦，我的Sapphire女神，我回来了！
这个血雨腥风、魂牵梦绕的竞技场，就是童年和青春的烙印，现在，它又要回来了，虽然回归的道路似乎很坎坷，陷入了无限A测，但是我们有耐心，有信心，有决心，竞技场的勇士们，再次沐浴起血雨吧！

+ Большое разнообразие оружия и карт

23961733.review:
This brings back so many memories... The first actual pc games i played were Unreal Tournament 2003 and Unreal Tournament 2004. These two games got me into pc gaming, not just because of the gratuidous violence or the simple way the game is laid out to you, it was the fact that they have almost endless replay value. Yea, the graphics dont look as good as they did back then but they were never developed for the extreme high definition displays we use today, But they still look amazing, especially since even if you have a lower end gaming rig, you can still play it with graphics maxed out. 
The fact that Steam only has UT2004 and not UT2003 is a big letdown especially since they are missing a few other Unreal games, but with the supply of mods (if you know where to look and find them) adds even more fun, i didnt know about modding when i first played, so with the user created content floating out around the web...it basicly creates a whole new experiance .
The Pro's
Low end rigs should have little trouble if most of the hardware is from the last few years (i even tested it on my old compaq laptop that hated running games and got 30-50 fps on medium to high settings)
Nearly unlimited replay value
Multiplayer is still up//LAN//Dedicated server/hosted(pay-to-host)/listen servers(you host as you play)
Tons of mod content ranging from skins, voice packs, maps, mutators, gamemodes and more.
Includes unreal editor in game files so you can create content
Custom Mappable Controls
Setting to toggle gore for people with weak stomachs or children
Plenty of weapons and vehicles for all the violent fun
Singleplayer
Voice Chat for those who know how to set it up
Power-ups granting damage bonuses, invisibility, and more
Play alone in instant action with bots and manipulate the ai difficulty ranging from a basic dummy ai that can get kills on you occasionally up to the God-Like ai that paints whatever is behind you with your blood (useful for practice)
So much more that cant even be described

The Con's
Often first time startup can be problematic with some higher resolution displays(simple fix by changing certain values in the games config, search google for fix)
Mod content can sometimes be hard to find due to some file servers permanently archiving files or hard to understand install instructions
Steam wont allow multiple instances of the game running (For example you open the game and set up a dedicated server, you cant open another instance of the game to play on your dedicated server unless you are smart enough to outsmart steam...hehe im not sharing my secrets..)
Some resolutions dont always scale just right when using an HDTV as a monitor (lots of trial and error finding a resolution you are comfortable with)

Overall Unreal Tournament 2004 gets a 9 out of 10
*hops in scorpion, drives across map running down every enemy player/bot hops out to get in goliath, gets sniped . Respawns, grabs rocket launcher , Gets revenge*

23588469.review:
Played UT2004 an insane amount when it came out, and up until a few years ago. Once I saw it on here, I had to get it again. It is just as awesome as it always has been. It is THE best arena shooter, just above Quake 3, and is an absolute classic! Plays as good today as it did 12 years ago! Recommended for anyone that's into FPSs, past or present.

***Side note***
It has issues running on Windows 10 at the moment. 
To fix the problem do the following (as originally commented by Steam user "tacobob", but I can confirm, this DOES fix the issue)

Go to 
C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Unreal Tournament 2004\System
and look for and open UT2004.ini

Find the section with the below entries:

[Engine.Engine]
RenderDevice=D3D9Drv.D3D9RenderDevice
;RenderDevice=D3D9Drv.D3D9RenderDevice
;RenderDevice=Engine.NullRenderDevice
;RenderDevice=OpenGLDrv.OpenGLRenderDevice
;RenderDevice=PixoDrv.PixoRenderDevice

Replace the "D3D9Drv.D3D9RenderDevice" on the first line with "OpenGLDrv.OpenGLRenderDevice" (without quotes)

It'll look like this:

[Engine.Engine]
RenderDevice=OpenGLDrv.OpenGLRenderDevice
;RenderDevice=D3D9Drv.D3D9RenderDevice
;RenderDevice=Engine.NullRenderDevice
;RenderDevice=OpenGLDrv.OpenGLRenderDevice
;RenderDevice=PixoDrv.PixoRenderDevice

23459467.review:
This game is often called the "last hardcore arena shooter".
Epic refined the arena FPS action pioneered by the Quake series and the original Unreal Tournament.
There are few games I have enjoyed more than this one. All of the gamemodes from deathmatch to CTF to Bombing Run to Assault require a different skillset than most gamers are used to. This game was ahead of its time.
The music is absolutely phenomenal, as is expected of the Unreal series. I listen to it even when I'm not playing the game.
Somebody had an interesting metaphor that I will use: in the FPS genre, Wolfenstein 3D was the wheel, Doom was the horse drawn carriage, Quake was the combustion engine, and Half-Life was the Ford Model T. 
In my opinion, UT99 was the Ferrari 458 or the Noble M600.
Which makes this game about the equivelant of an F-22 Raptor.
However, there is one thing that I wish this game had,
The weapon with which I defeated Xan Kriegor in the original Unreal Tournament
The Ripper
RIP the Ripper
But Hey: at least the Lightning Gun is fun.
And my second favorite weapon, the shock rifle, is still here. 
Please, Epic: make the new Unreal Tournament more like this.
10/10 would try turning the safety off again.

23375430.review:
我有多爱这款游戏呢，光实体版我就有四套，而且如果我有机会还能遇见，我大概还会买，就是爱到了这个份儿上，如果说有哪一款FPS游戏可以用“完美”来形容，我说，就是虚幻竞技场2004，但是这游戏在中国压根没有火过一秒钟，甚至在这游戏最火爆的0405年左右，中国虚幻论坛上的会员也就零星一百来人，德国Boy倒是火得一塌糊涂，但没几个人知道他在视频里玩儿就是虚幻竞技场2004，而且从音乐能知道他玩儿的应该是TokaraForest这张地图，挺难的一张图，怪不得砸键盘。

最标准的虚幻2引擎质量，最高质量的画面（当年），屌爆的音乐，经典的音效和旁白（玩儿够了dota，lol也应该知道一下“First Blood”,“Double Kill””God like“这些词儿是从哪儿来的），兼顾竞技性和娱乐性，既有quake的节奏和暴力，亦有cs的配合和技巧，据点模式和攻防模式甚至有BF的战略性和场面，更别提它还有自家的橄榄球和秒杀夺旗模式，拥有十几种独特的武器，且每一种都有两种甚至两种以上的攻击方式，操作上更是有独特的移动和跳跃技巧，WCG连续四年的比赛项目，当年可有不少职业cs选手和quake选手转行到虚幻竞技场2004。

但我更想说的是，这款游戏的扩展性。即使是今天你依然可以找到很多网站可以下载巨量的地图皮肤人物插件和模组。
从火柴人到达斯维德到二次元少女到猎奇生物无所不有，可以一直收集到你的角色库密密麻麻。
从细小的补丁式插件到强大到颠覆整个游戏规则的插件几乎无所不有，而且可以随意混搭在一起用，可以让你把最普通的死亡竞赛变成卡通地图+零重力+超级武器+大头模式+传送门+魔法+子弹时间+生成僵尸的超级混搭游戏，你能想象有多有趣。

最后我们来重点说说mods，虚幻竞技场2004当年举办过奖品奢侈的mod制作比赛，所以这款游戏应该是是目前世界上mod数量最多且质量最高的游戏
这么说吧，一般游戏里比如老滚辐射求生战地红警里我们所说的mod，在虚幻竞技场2004里充其量也就算个插件而已，虚幻竞技场2004的mod几乎就是一个个以虚幻竞技场2004蓝本为基础的独立游戏，即使是单纯的武器mod，它都有着整套的规则系统和独立UI，而非单纯的改改模型贴图改改数据。

Alien swarm，Red Orchestra，Killingfloor这些游戏当年的原型全都是虚幻2004的mod，包括最近很火的Rocket League灵感都是完全来自当年Car ball这个mod，而且在Car ball里车辆可定制的部件和游戏元素远比rocket league还要丰富数倍。

还有纯粹踢球的deathball，开着热气球互轰的Airbuccaneers，模仿cs的TOCrossfire,冷兵器互砍的ChaosUT，赛车的Unwheel，更有星球大战，变形金刚，二战，僵尸，西部牛仔，海战，空战，太空战.....甚至还有高尔夫！全部都有自己独立的系统,多到这辈子都玩儿不完！

所以还在等什么？如果你喜欢fps游戏，这款游戏就算价格再加一个零也绝对值得你入！
而且服务器上至今也不冷清，玩儿的人依然很多！


但还是有几点得说一下：1.毕竟十多年前的古董游戏，对现在的系统和分辨率支持不是很好，但也不是玩儿不了，windows10需要修改一个游戏文件。2.这是一款最需要steam workshop的游戏却并没有workshop，实在可惜。3.虽然你24小时都能找到人很多的服务器，但也并没有那么多了，好多游戏模式已经完全没有服务器了，国内也只有几个不定期开放的私人竞技服。

头一次写这么多字儿，因为对这款游戏爱的深沉，打从这游戏横空出世一直到今天，它就一直呆在我换掉的每一台电脑里，我不指望还能让多少人爱上这款游戏，但还是希望没接触过它的人一定要试试这款曾堪称完美的FPS竞技游戏，毕竟相比虚幻竞技场99的画面更能让人接受，相比虚幻竞技场3它更朴实丰富，而且最新的虚幻竞技场4又已经在路上了，不如顺便感受一下它十多年前的辉煌。

UT04 is one of THE MOST fantastic and epic FPS out there! I can't do this game justice as it's practically apart of FPS History and even has some aspects adopted into...the MLG style.

Okay down to the game. UT 04 is a FPS Game with tons of maps, game modes and fun toys to play with. Typically in a game you can just stick with 1 or 2 weapon but about all the weapons are fantastic in this, with my favorite being the Flak Cannon: The love child of a grenade launcher and a shotgun! It has a simple yet pleasing graphic style, decent music to pump you up! It's moddable so you can have Optimus Prime (which was a really awesome looking skin I had awhile back) blowing people into tasty giblets. The excuse plot is short, sweet, and to the point: You wanna win the tournament, kick some ass! This is one of the few FPS games I can ever express only love for.

10/10

21838785.review:
Well, I fixed the little issue, amd drivers are so bad, anyway, I have come back with a different review, one of a more positive one. firstly I love the unreal tournament collection, it's always been my favourite FPS and I've never stopped enjoying the game, even if my record track says differently, secondly I recommend this game for a few great reasons:
1) Unreal Tournament brings hours of enjoyfull FPS combat, using amazing and fun weapons, like the flak cannon, a great shotgun-like weapon that fires flak at things or the redeemer, in my opinion the best weapon in the game, a mini nuke launcher that fires slowly but blows the hell out of a small area with one shot, great fun when you play it with an all redeemer setting!
2) You know those basic team-based FPS games that just bring in simple gamemodes like CTF or TDM or just basic DM? Well, how about a game that brings in more gamemodes than just that, like vehicle CTF, where you attack the enemy and take their flag using awesome cars that range from air to an artillery car to a tank to a little buggy that holds a blade that cuts through enemies! Then there's Onslaught, a fun game mode where two teams compete to capture key points to assault the enemy core directly it also involves vehicles, then there's assault, a fun attack and defend story-like driven game mode where one team defends their objectives while another must attack, the attackers win by completing the objectives, defenders win by holding back the attackers!
3) The vehicles! Who doesnt want to like those vehicles? Firstly we have our basic melee and ranged vehicle, the scorpion, this is the one packing those blades, as well as a special type of gun that has a beam similar to the link gun, but charges and then, when it hits can kill a basic troop instantly (as long as it's fully charged) and a manta. Next we have a kind of reconaisance vehicle, the manta, this is special, for it is the only ground vehicle that is allowed to jump, it also holds a plasma-based weapon system that fires two plasma shots at a time, holding down shift allows for vehicular manslaughter kills. Here's my favourite: The Leviathan, a 5 person manned vehicle that's main weapon is a rocket launcher (and the point defense weapons the other 4 people can man) and it's secondary, only capable of firing when the leviathan is deployed, is an ion cannon, capable of 1-hitting most things, it's great fun to have! Here's another of my favourites: limited only to the editors choice edition, the cicada. An air vehicle that's primary is missiles fired wildly at a single location, secondary is a lock on that, when held down, can fire multiple missiles at that target. The vehicle holds 2 seats, the second is a downward turret that's primary is an acurate high-firing turret, kills unprotected people and light vehicles easily, second fire is a harmless 'decoy' if you wish to call it that, which confuses locked on AVRIL and Raptor missiles, causing them to target the decoy instead.
4) The maps, ah the maps, though I may not know them off by heart I can tell you that there are tonnes of maps and they're all great fun to play on, ranging from ons-arcticstronghold to DM-junkyard to AS-convoy! ONS/DM/AS are all abreviations for their full game mode name, like how ONS is onslaught and AS is assault.
5) The campaign, I think one thing that made this game series great was the campaign, the campaign for the UT series was always great fun, in UT 2004 you'd be tasked with making to the top of the tournament leaderboard through hours of great fun and sometimes tricky missions, first you would have to do the qualification ladder, getting you into the tournament, then it'd be the team qualifications, where you fight other teams with you just hand made team in TDM trying to get fully qualified into the game, then it'd go on into different tournamnet ladders, firstly being the CTF ladder, then domination and it'd keep going until you'd completed all the ladders and become the champion of the tournament, from time to time you'd get challenged by an enemy team in little challenges known as blood rites or head to head where you'd fight against that opponent for their member in replacement of one of yours, though that's just the blood rites, head to head is a 1-on-1 DM challenge where the first person to get the set amount of frags (kills) wins, and takes with them a certain amount of cash from the fight!

Also, I recommend using Nvidia drivers, as when my friend (and I) tried using an amd driver it messed up the system, deleting a folder and also screwing up the graphics, other than that it's great fun!

[b]Изменение разрешения экрана.[/b]

[list]
 [*] Ищем файл "UT2004.ini"
В моем случае он находится здесь:
...\steamapps\common\Unreal Tournament 2004\System
 [*] Открываем его блокнотом и находим следующие строчки:
WindowedViewportX=800
WindowedViewportY=600
FullscreenViewportX=800
FullscreenViewportY=600
 [*] Меняем разрешение на необходимое для вас и жмем сохранить:(я решил проблему выставив в файле (моё разрешение):
WindowedViewportX=1366
WindowedViewportY=768
FullscreenViewportX=1366
FullscreenViewportY=768
 [*] Запускаем игру, всё готово.
[/list]

[h1] Чертовы мины-пауки [/h1]
Перед вами довольно таки не новая игра, хочу сказать. НО, это не делает игру плохой. Игра - шикарна. Оружия, экшон, кровушка. Даже есть кампания, ребятня. Я наигрался в нее до этого, она произвела на меня приятное впечатление.
Если говорить по существу и без воды, перед вами что-то типа Quake. Доставляют оружия, будь то щит, автомат (нет. эта перделка ничерта не доставляет), ракетница, мины-пауки и так далее. В игре присутствуют разнообразные режимы. Есть стандартные, типа каждый сам за себя, командное рубилово человек\роботов\ХренПоймиКого, захват флага и прочее. Есть вещи повеселее. например некое извращенное подобие регби или захват точек на разнообразном транспорте. ДА, тут есть транспорт, но только в этом режиме.
В игре в принципе достаточно разных карт и режимов. каждый найдет что-то себе. Уж поверьте.
10 винтовок-молний из 10

21145918.review:
Потрясающая стрелялка версии 2004 года.
Плюсы:
+Выдающаяся графика
+Уникальный геймплей сочетающий плюсы быстрых и медленных шутеров
+Лучшие боты на тот момент (да и сейчас одни из лучших)
+Громадное количество режимов, начиная с простейших - дезматча и захвата флага заканчивая монструозным онслаутом и футболом с пушками
+Живое до сих пор комьюнити
+Гора модов в том числе и кардинально меняющих геймплей
+Весьма необычная компания
+Запоминающийся саундтрек
Минусы:
-Онлайн лобби сделаны еще по старому образцу и работают не слишком хорошо на данный момент
-Чересчур высокий порог вхождения в игру, как и в квейк, в эту игру впихнули слишком много фич, новичек будет шокирован количеством фишек которые придется освоить.

Хоть игре уже 12 лет играется до сих пор бодро и свежо, однозначный must have.

There's nothing better than capturing the last flag or getting the last frag in instagib and it's always good to hear "HOLY SH*T" When you set your graphics to the max and hear the sexy lady shout out "GODLIKE" when you're just killing people. Moved to the correct section. QA section is intended only for the new UT.

So far this looks to be a generic problem with UE2-based games on Win10. For UT2004 there is a workaround - switching from D3D to OpenGL. Go to UT2004\System folder, open UT2004.ini and find the [Engine.Engine] section. Add ; before the RenderDevice=D3DDrv.D3DRenderDevice line and remove it before the RenderDevice=OpenGLDrv.OpenGLRenderDevice line, so it looks like this:


X:\Steam\steamapps\common\Unreal Tournament 2004\System\UT2004.ini

Заменяем строчку [Engine.Engine]
Code:
[Engine.Engine]
;RenderDevice=D3DDrv.D3DRenderDevice
 RenderDevice=OpenGLDrv.OpenGLRenderDevice
;RenderDevice=Engine.NullRenderDevice
;RenderDevice=PixoDrv.PixoRenderDevice

20552181.review:
[b]Intro[/b]
The best arena FPS of all time, perhaps tied with its predecessor, Unreal Tournament '99. My 200+ hours are all without having played a single match online and I could easily spend 500+ hours on each game mode. So far I've barely played CTF and played a few matches of each game mode and spent the rest doing nothing but Deathmatch and some Team Deathmatch. This also excludes my huge amount of playtime on the disk version. This games balancing is fantastic, the gunplay is almost arena perfection and the amount of content shoved into this game is insane. I'd happily pay $70+ for this game today (don't get any ideas though, game developers).

[b]The Great:[/b]
++The original Unreal arsenal is back once again making for some more classic Unreal gameplay
++The amount of maps, character models and game modes will no doubt keep you entertained for hundreds of hours
++Movement is entirely unique to the genre, even within the Unreal series itself, and adds up for some frantic competitive arena action
++SinglePlayer tournament ladder is a huge step up from both of the previous Tournament games in the series

[b]The Good:[/b]
+Some really good remixes of UT99 music
+The gore is a large improvement from UT99 (and UT3) and it's awesome to see limbs flying every which direction
+AI is really fucking  good
+Huge variety of character models and many choices between them
+Enemy clarification is easy and the game gives you visual and auditory feedback from the games' systems very well
+A vast array of mutators
+Total control of gameplay options in every concievable way and settings to allow you to choose your look and style any which way you like
+Almost every song that was also in Unreal Championship rules

[b]The Okay/Not Too Big of a Deal:[/b]
+-The music isn't as good as Michael Van der Bros' and Alexander Brandon's (and other composers) work on UT99 or Unreal but it's certainly not bad, just dissapointing in comparison
-+Maps are not as good as UT99 but they're not bad and therefore not a case of quality over quantity as there's still plenty of both
+-Game doesn't look that good with some unimpressive lighting and an unnattractive art-style. Not ugly, and visual clarification is easy, just not as good as it probably should look for a game from 2004.

[b]The Bad:[/b]
-The new game modes are largely filler and gimmicky. Not without their merits, but they're still pretty poor.
-Some maps either seem to limit the movement options too much purposely or weren't made for them in mind, meaning you can't traverse the level as easy
-Performance is okay but high resolutions aren't supported without file editing and to get perfect mouse control you have to do some file tweaking due to the game crashing on Windows 10 if you pick Raw Mouse Input. Game also crashes on majority of Windows 10 computers if you don't get a fix. More of a hassle than anything.
-Maps such in comparison to other instalments in the series
-Accident dodge is infuriating and common. A key to dodge would be far more helpful
-I like the audio, but the actual quality is low and badly mixed

[b]The Horrible:[/b]
--Playing this as a single-player game is impossible unless you do nothing but deathmatch. You could be the greatest of the great, but when your teammate AI commonly stands around doing nothing and you face the entire enemy team alone in a game of CTF when you have the flag, skill is irrelevant. The AI has so many issues that make any game mode other than deathmatch a pure chore. Here's a list of AI issues: AI are deaf. I have seen a case where a guy was defending the flag but he was useless because he was looking the other way and despite being 2cm away from the eenmy taking the flag he couldn't see them so he didn't know they were there. It's very common to see team mates standing around doing nothing which makes me want to destroy my monitor every time. It's common to see team mates totally ignore the fact that you have the flag or ball and don't defend you and instead run off to grab a link gun. AI love to pick up equipment, even if they have the whole enemy team behind them when they have the flag. AI don't miss with the flak cannon at close range. AI don't miss with the link gun secondary. AI dodge incoming attacks from rockets and etc. even if they're not looking at you and should have no sense of them being fired at them, which is ridiculous. AI have no dodge downtime and can dodge all they like, whereas you have to have a short break before dodging again. The list goes on and on. If you play this for deathmatch solo it is amazing. Any other game mode, including team, don't bother. These issues happen at easy difficulties as well. At Godlike? Team games are up to luck basically.
--Weapon balancing has severe issues. The 2 main hitscan weapons, the Shock Rifle and the Sniper/Lightning Gun are far better than anything else in all situations except maybe the Flak Cannon. Arena FPS is meant to be about dedicated weapons to specific scenarios. There should be no weapon to rule them all, and yet there's two (technically 3).
--Level design is far, far inferior to UT99. The main issue I have with it though is that every map seems to have every weapon on it. That means those 2 all-scenario weapons are on every map meaning everyone's rushing to get those weapons and every game plays the same. In UT99, maps sometimes had a focus on a weapon or a group of weapons. This game has the vast majority of maps having every weapon included, but who cares about the rest when you have 2 hitscan weapons to get.

Sound: 5.5/10
Graphics: 6.5/10
Gameplay: 10/10
Content/Replayability: 10/10
Overall: 9/10

[b]Conclusion[/b]
An almost flawless game online with everything that made UT99 so goddamn amazing and a fuck  ton more. Seriously a must-buy for multiplayer FPS fans of any type.

20281053.review:
Before there was Killing Floor...

Before there was Team Fortress 2...

There was this game.

Despite how it's aged quite a bit, the graphics still look very impressive for a 2004 game, and just about any old PC (like mine) can play it with very little to no lag at all. The frame rate never dips and the action is still fast paced.

[h1]PROS:[/h1]
+ Graphics, while dated a bit, still looks good in today's times
+ The sounds in this game just scream nostalgia when you look back at classic FPS games
+ Controls are very simple and easy to pick up

[h1]CONS:[/h1]
- None at all that I know of

Overall, this game is flawless, it's nostalgic (in today's times), and it was this game that introduced us to Killing Floor, which started out as a mod for this game that has since become its own standalone title.

10/10 - A classic gem that desperately needs people to apprecieate its beauty once more.

Команда: Принято

Симулятор понимания команды 10/10


[h1]Серьезный обзор[/h1]
Игра заставляет развивать ваш скилл. Сначала можно победить не прилагая усилий потом вам дается "команда", и после командного турнира, начинается  самое интересное: Против вас начинает играть всё более и более сильная команда, а какого бы человека ты не брал, в твоей команде он полное гавно. Даже если ты взял существо из самой сильной команды, будьте уверены, в вашей он будет играть как гавно. Ты можешь убить всю команду противников за 1 жизнь, и даже не знаешь, какую выбирать тактику:

Посылаешь всю команду захватить флаг, один защищаешь флаг.
Faraleth: Захватил флаг (комната с флагом синих)
Nerbi: У нас потери
Система: Флаг красных возвращен

Вся команда защищает флаг, один нападаешь:
Флаг они защищают отменно (ну конечно, если вся команда стоит, фиг 3 против 5-и попрешь)
Захватываешь флаг. зареспился красный, снимаешь 70 хп, прошел четверть пути. Зареспился другой, убиваешь 40 хп, пол пути. На тебя прет вся красная команда с захваченным флагом, убивает, красные +1 очко

3 чела защищают, ты прешь с другим:
То же самое, только +5 секунд, пока другого не убьют.


Так же могу заметить, что показатели мало влияет на то, как бот играет. Например, Ген мо'Каи (средние) играют лучше чем с человек из "Удар Грома (Богоподобные)"


Тем не менее, если вы не играли в UT 1999, рекомендую. По сравнению с другими играми, интересная. По сравнению с UT1999...

20197035.review:
I'm not exactly a fan of this iteration of the UT series, but there's one thing that I wish the upcoming new one could also have: team management in the Tournament campaign.

It's like a career mode in FIFA or something, but instead of playing football and managing a football team, you play UT. Buying/selling arena fighters, each with their own attributes and weapon preferences and then playing with the is the most fun this game offers. They can get injuries as well, which you need to treat, or else they remain on the bench. You can assign them positions on the field as well (cover you, defend/attack base, sweep etc.)

It's an amazing idea and very well suited for a game like UT. I hope this idea will be taken to the next level.

19929014.review:
Ok.  Not working on Windows 10?  No problem!  At least until the next Win update breaks it.
Go to C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Unreal Tournament 2004\System
and look for and open UT2004.ini

Find the section with the below entries:

[Engine.Engine]
RenderDevice=D3D9Drv.D3D9RenderDevice
;RenderDevice=D3D9Drv.D3D9RenderDevice
;RenderDevice=Engine.NullRenderDevice
;RenderDevice=OpenGLDrv.OpenGLRenderDevice
;RenderDevice=PixoDrv.PixoRenderDevice

Replace the "D3D9Drv.D3D9RenderDevice" on the first line with "OpenGLDrv.OpenGLRenderDevice" (without quotes).
It'll look like this:
[Engine.Engine]
RenderDevice=OpenGLDrv.OpenGLRenderDevice
;RenderDevice=D3D9Drv.D3D9RenderDevice
;RenderDevice=Engine.NullRenderDevice
;RenderDevice=OpenGLDrv.OpenGLRenderDevice
;RenderDevice=PixoDrv.PixoRenderDevice

I've tried the NullRenderDevice and Pixo and the only one that worked every time on my new machine is the OpenGL though pixo works sometimes.  Once it runs you can play around with the settings as you see fit.  

You're welcome!

19595904.review:
IF YOU AREN'T PLAYING UNREAL TOURNAMENT, YOU HAVEN'T PLAYED VIDEO GAMES. IF YOU HAVEN'T PLAYED VIDEO GAMES, GO GET A LIFE!

(BEFORE STARTING OFF : if you are experiencing troubles regarding your screen moving without you touching it, [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=572301053]you're going to have to uncheck the following : mouse smoothing, reduce mouse lag and enable joystick.[/url] I haven't figured out yet how to play with a controller).

All honesty though, this game has come quite the way from it's original conception. Back in the day Unreal was an amazing shooter and still to this day still holds highly to it's acclaim. The mods have helped significantly to keep the game interesting. 

Unreal Tournament is most likely known for it's obscene commentary, extreme gore, and weapons that aliens look like they developed. Before you start playing multiplayer, there is a campaign available that will get you ready for multiplayer. In UT, you may customize your character from a large select group of races in which each have their own attributes. The guns in this game are absolutely fantastic. They range from basic shotgun and rockets to energy weapons that will vaporize an opponent. I should say the guns are one of the main reasons why this game got so big; the fact they also introduced alternative firing with both the same amount of strength really plays to the shooters advantage. The game play itself compared to other shoots is a little fast as players move throughout the map with speed. 

[b]Movement/controls[/b] is quite basic but includes sprinting, crouching, jumping, lateral movements and double tapping a movement button will make the player roll forward. Like Halo, you won't find many players standing still to take a shot as you are absolutely vulnerable when not in motion. What blew my mind was one map I played online where I was not only able to enjoy the basics the game came with, but some crazy yahoo out there took his time to make vehicles (that resemble warthogs), ghost sort of looking vehicles that can jump vertically up and down, tanks and of course a ship that flies through the air. The mods get pretty crazy and some maps feature fixed guns. Game modes that are available in this game are standard deathMatch, team deathMatch, capture the flag and double domination (which is sort of like King of the Hill). Upon killing a lot of opponents or collecting adrenaline, players can use it for regeneration (Down, Down, Down, Down), invisibility (Right, Right, Left, Left), faster rate of fire (Up, Up, Down, Down) and faster movement speed (Up, Up, Up, Up) - (pint size and berserk are also available but I do not know the proper combos... yet). This adds an extra depth to already an enjoyable game. Picking up more health, armor or even ammo is quite easy and shouldn't be too much of an issue to get the gun you want. It's how much can you dodge while you're getting there. I should also add the maps I've come across so far have been superb.

The [b]visuals[/b] are as good as they can be for their age and an update to them could make or break the game. It's vintage-ness is what's really appreciated. [b]Sounds[/b] are pretty good, although basic and not extremely varied but provide a good context for the gun you're firing. 

I would absolutely recommend this game on sale to anyone. It is simply a fun FPS that can be enjoyed by anyone. You will quickly see some players that have really taken their time to precise their movements and their shooting patterns.



RATING : rock solid 8/10

19554511.review:
Unreal Tournament '99 was one of the first serious FPS games I played. I'd played good ones before, like DN3D, and Doom and stuff, but then came this, THIS game, and it blew me away. Then I played Unreal, as I recall. I played that afterwards, I don't really know how I missed it.

Anyway. That was it. I was a huge fan of UT from then on. It was great fun with friends and family.

Then UT 2003 came out, and that, that was an awesome game. I loved it. I loved it... but I actually preferred '99. I don't really remember why. I still played the hell out of UT 2003 though. Then, we got 2004. Which was so awesome I instantly switched to it and never really looked back (until now, really, I still love '99 because 2004 doesn't really capture the same spirit that '99 had).

UT 2004 however is unbelievably fantastic. When it comes to turbo-classic FPS games, this one should be up there with Quake, Doom, Duke Nukem, Daikatana (pfft), whatever. It's considered by many to be the grand champion of the UT series, which is still going strong today (sort of).

I, for one, am super hyped for the UT '99 remake, or whatever it is that Epic Games are doing. But until then, UT 2004. It's got mods, it's still being played, it's great. Get it.

19533460.review:
Любимая игра вот уже более десяти лет. До сих пор не встречал ничего лучше. Игра по максимуму задействует рефлексы и ум. Местная акробатика - просто божественна! Как божественны и местные боты - даже спустя столько лет заставляют нервно курить современные ИИ даже из сингловых шутанов.
Механика игры подобна шахматам - такая же простая и глубокая. А проработанность всех деталей и мелочей просто невообразима. Чего стоит только Линк, лучем которого можно усиливать своих товарищей, который, для удобства, "прилипает" к ним и так просто не расконтачится.
И графика, я скажу так - она может и менее технологичная нежели в UT3, но смотрится приятней и красивей. Она сочная и яркая. Как яркие и харизматичные персонажи этой игры - от каких-то космических египтян до могущественных Скааржей.
Я намерено не затронул мультиплеер, т.к. интернет у меня появился, когда активность этой игры уже была в районе 5-10 серваков на весь свет. Но я всё же поиграл немного на некоторых и скажу прямо - это незабываемый экпириенс! Особенно на Асолте, на самодельных кооп картах - когда 30 человек пытается сдюжить хитроумную загадку и пробраться до рубильника живыми.
Засим откланяюсь. Нужно ещё выпить с Малькольмом.

18009963.review:
Привет, пользователь.
Мы - разработчики Анрил 2004. Ты новенький в шутерах? Никогда не пользовал жанр дефматч? Не знаешь, как бежать с пушкой, стреляющей без перезарядки и точно в точку, минуя законы физики?
Хочешь научиться получать от этого дикое удовольствие? 
Ах, после нас мы выпустили еще один анрил... Мы думаем, что он всё равно не превзойдет эту часть. 
Короче, следуй за нами...
Да, здесь есть сингл плеер. 
Мы попытались сделать его идеальным. Ты наверное и не представляешь, как мы старались. Сделать его идеальным. 
Правильная история, грамотный набор карт и написанные умными людьми боты. 
В наше время хорошее соединение было на вес золота, и люди редко наслаждались игрой по сетке с хорошей графикой и без лагов. Поэтому мы постарались передать нашим современникам максимальную идею дефтматча через сингплеер. И в этом нам помог компьютерный интеллект. Сейчас наверное тебя этим не удивить, но наш A.I. через огонь и воду прошёл, чтобы преподать тебе лучшие уроки сетевой игры и подсадить на этот наркотик.
Возможно, даже с людьми не так приятно входить в тему, как с нашими "написанными" друзьями. Боты у нас прекрасны, только попробуй.
В течении нашего "турнира" мы придумали все так, чтобы ты прочувствовал каждую пушку в руках. Например есть этап, гда рулят только снайперские винтовки. Ну, конечно,  всё это - только для того, чтобы ты встретился с реальными людьми в сети уже подкованным, то никто не застрахует тебя от приятнейших воспоминаний от прохождения Unreal Tournament 2004 в единственном числе. В 2015 году. Удачи тебе, пользователь, на просторах дальнейших попыток сторонних разработчиков повторить наш подвиг.

17978724.review:
[b]The glory days of Unreal Tournament 2004 are long gone.[/b]

Unreal Tournament 2004 was probably one of the best games of 2004, with frantic, fast-paced gameplay, tons of different modes, and plenty of mod support.  However, time hasn't been kind to UT2004.  

Doom 3 would hold the crown for graphical excellence for quite a while,  World of Warcraft would become the most popular MMORPG of all time, Half-Life 2 would spawn several expansions and an annoying meme, etc.

Although Unreal Tournament 3 was a reasonably successful sequel, the series has been off the radar for quite a while, which makes UT2004, along with its aging graphics and nonexistent playerbase, a thing of the past.
