The good old sounds of Rocket Fire and Plasma rifles.
The sweet smell of gun smoke and blood.
The soothing sounds of enemy champion screams.
The shot that came across the map and hit a players head very majesticly.
The wonderful Flak Cannon shot that made a player explode.
The greatest Shock Core blast that hit a player in mid-air.
The wonderful hit of the Link gun turning a player into a (Spooky Scary) skeleton.                                                                  It makes me wonder why I even play Team Fortress.

9.7/10 Thanks for nostalgic memories and the best childhood of my life Epic Games.

17492044.review:
Nie zliczę godzin które spędziłem w tej grze lata temu. Seria Unreal towarzyszy w moim growym życiu od czasów pierwszego PCta, to właśnie na starym Celeronie 2.6ghz i GeForce FX5200 docierałem swojego skilla w pierwszej części tej wyśmienitej serii. Dzisiaj mamy już prawie 11lat od czasów wydania UT2k4 i wciąż na serwerach można znaleźć masę graczy  i multum serwerów do gry. Polecam wszystkim osobom które pamiętają Tournamenta z 1999 roku, to ta sama rozwałka w trochę świeższym wydaniu. Minusy? Na upartego są aż dwa:
-Brak nowszej wersji mapy Lava Giant . Jest wprawdzie podobna CTF-Magma, ale to nie to samo w mojej ocenie, brak tego specyficznego klimatu.
-Cena wersji Steam, która cały czas trzyma moim skromnym zdaniem wysoki poziom(jak na nasze zarobki). Co jak co ale ta pozycja, jak już wcześniej wspomniałem, trochę lat już ma. Mogliby spuścić trochę z tonu :)
Podsumowując, weterani Q3 i pierwszego UT powinni ten tytuł w swojej bibliotece mieć! 10/10 ode mnie. PLAY!!

Fix: if you switch to windows 10 you have to go to 
"C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Unreal Tournament 2004\System\UT2004.ini" then locate [D3DDrv.D3DRenderDevice] then below this divider you will find ReduceMouseLag=True, change it to False. After that, simply save then play.

TL;DR
10/10 - This game is one of the best out there, because of it's fast paced FPS style and large amounts of gore (can be changed in settings). Also, it has amazing graphics for it's time and is simply a fun game to spend hours playing.

17242322.review:
UT = Classic. Best aethestics, in my opinion, looks and sounds decent even by today's standards. Honestly wish UT had all the gameplay features of UT2004. Only one without vehicles.

UT2004 = Best gameplay. Graphics for textures have aged a bit, but not a huge deal. Best when it comes to variety in general. Decent customization. Single-player most resembled a tournament. "Silliest" of the three, in my opinion, but also the most fun.

UT3 = Not nearly as bad as everyone says. Desaturation can easily be turned off. People complaining about the story don't make sense to me...UT isn't supposed to have a good story, and at least they were tongue-in-cheek about it. ("The F.L.A.G bit will make you laugh.) Best visual design, except for chracters being GoWish. Sound is still good. Similar to UT2004 in gameplay...but good luck finding a game online with people in it. (Sigh.)

If you have to pick *one*, go with UT2004. Especially for the multiplayer.

16717673.review:
I've owned this game in two forms, physical disc via the Unreal Collection (Unreal, Unreal 2, UT99 and UT2k4) and via Steam now as the Editor's Choice edition. I would get UT3 but I don't like its aesthetic and I don't like how it STILL doesn't have the same amount of mods and custom models as UT2k4.

As a result, I still have UT2k4 and I'm not giving it up. UT2K4 has all the mods I liked of UT99 and has even more custom skins and models that people have made that look great. I mean hell I can play as an adorable fox girl in UT2K4. I can't do that in UT99 or UT3, and until UT4 comes out I can't play that as anything but Stock Male #3 which is DULLLLLL.

So yeah. I'm still playing this because I can play Junkwar or Ballistic Weapons or have a ninja rope or play as a cute fox girl with huge guns (I do mean guns, not boobs; don't be ridiculous, you are not 12 years old. unless you are. in which case do your parents know what you are doing??), or I can do all of those at the same time.

And you know what? The game still looks remarkably pretty too even 10+ years in the future. That's the strength of the Unreal engine for you.

16557631.review:
If you have to decide between Unreal Tournament (the one released in 1998) and Unreal Tournament 2004, i would say to go with Unreal tournament 98. Here's the reason why

Graphics: "Muh graphics suck" is no longer an excuse because both game have outdated graphics. You wouldn't buy Unreal Tournament for muh graphics now, would you?

Domination: Let's face it, the mod domination suck in UT2k4 while in the old unreal tournament, it is an epic win.

New weapons: they are all weaker vs they original state, i find way better the sniper rifle than the lighting gun, because the lighting gun aim like shit. The so called replacer for rocket launcher can't shoot multiple rocket at the same time making it weak. Oh and did i mentionned that the good old rocket launcher can no longer throw grenade?

less gore: I can't believe i'm saying this but there is more gore in UT98 than in UT2k4... yeah i'm dead serious. if you're lucky, maybe a part of a guy will explose from time to time, but you won't be able to explode the rest of the corpse like you can in UT98 and the corpse just vanish 5 second after you killed your target.

Fucking farming: Now you can personalise your team and steal other's team's member. problem is, if you don't do it, you'll end up with a team that really suck, but you need to farm again and again to get this amount of money to be able to send them a challenge request and you have to win or you lose all your money so you have to farm again and again and again. So really, if you want a good old Unreal Tournament, get this one that come out in 1998... If you really are a die fan of unreal tournament and want them all for yourself, well yes those point might not be the biggest deal. Do what you want really, i just told why i don't recommend this game, but if you want to buy it, who care? certainly not me.

16520850.review:
Z serią Unreal jestem związany od dość dawna i musze powiedzieć, że jets to jedna z nielicznych gier, której następne odsłony nie są odcinaniem kuponów. Zdarzały sie co prawda nie do końca przemyslane decyzje, jednak koniec końców złe praktyki zostały wykorzenione i ogniem wypalone a te dobre staraniie pielęgnowane.

Kolejny raz możemy wziąc udział w Nierealnym Turnieju, lecz tym razem jest on zrealizowany o wiele bardziej profesionalnie - coś co było kiedyś tylko więzienną rozrywką stało sie sportem, kompletowanie druzyny, wpisowe do walk, nowe tryby rozgrywki takie jak Onslaught czy Bombing Run, powrót starszych takich jak Assault, nie do końca rozumiana przeze mnie rezygnacja z Rippera, pojazdy dzięki którym gra przypomina swoja strukturą Battlefield'a, rozległe mapy, nowe rasy postaci, to wszystko sprawia, że gra jest za******a. Głównym wątkiem gry jest oczywiście wojna ludzi ze Skarii i powiem tylko, że będziemy mieli dośc istotny w nią wkład (spoiler alert), nawet taka szczątkowa fabuła nie psuje turniejowej konwencji i nadaje jej smaczku a nam motywacji do działania. Na końcu oczywiście po raz kolejny zmierzymy się z Xanem na remeke'u mapy Hyper Blast. Świetna gra, którą warto odpalić sobie po całym dniu frustrującej pracy :)

16091734.review: This is a classic LAN party favorite. It's fast-paced and exhilarating. The mods are insane (there's a gravity gun in one of them that you simply MUST use in the Valarna map for the most epic pole-vaulting experience ever.) The game-types (Onslaught, CTF, Deathmatch, etc) are excellent. The Community Bonus Packs are must-haves. This is a game you can enjoy alone or with friends. And you will enjoy it.

16049953.review:
This and the original Unreal Tournament are my all time favorite games.  Fantastic solo and team FPS play.  So many different game types (DM, Team DM, 1 on 1 Arena DM, CTF, Vehicle CTF, Onslaught, and more)..  And Mutators - which allow you to tweak and alter the game in interesting and sometimes hilarious ways.

And the community is second to none.  The Unreal Editor has always been free, and the community have used it to create killer maps, and even complete mods for different games altogether.

I think UT 2004 still looks great, and now in 2015, will probably run on most everybody's machine.

UT 99 (the original) was great and so was UT 3.  UT 2014/15 (currently in Alpha and free to play) is looking so good too.  But if i had to pick a favorite, it is this one:   UT 2004.

15667730.review:
[i]The review is written strictly from single-player perspective![/i]

[h1]Short version: 94%[/h1]
UT2k4 is, with little doubt, the pinnacle of the Unreal franchise with the largest variation in game modes, best maps, biggest arsenal, and one of the best AI opponents of its time.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
It took almost four years for Epic to create a sequel to Unreal Tournament, and they were aiming high with a proposed yearly series. Sadly, they started with UT2003, which changed and removed so many things that despite the initial success it flopped hard: so much so that they had to release Unreal Tournament 2004 well ahead schedule. Thankfully they listened to the fans, and not only gave back every removed game element, but created an amalgam of the best features of UT2003 and UT ’99.

The action is faster than ever, but not to the point where it is disadvantageous to a new player. Old weapons and map types complement the new ones, offering a variety not just in play style, but in game modes– including a Halo-inspired vehicle-using war scenario.
The campaign also received an overhaul. You still need to complete all but one game type to win, but the small changes made sure that each play through can be different: instead of set maps you are given a small pool for each stage. For death match enthusiast 1v1 and team DMs are offered as optional challenges, boosting the possible team management strategies and game time to even higher levels.

Some of the game modes like Bombing Run (a cross between Blood Bowl and Counter-Strike) and Double Domination (Domination with camping strategies) weren’t received well, but against bots they can be one of the fastest-paced modes you can play. And even if you dislike them, the other modes and the myriad of high-quality player-made map packs can ensure longevity even after all these years.

15659535.review:
雖然UT2004的遊戲引擎以現今來說是有些落伍了，但是它的畫面以現在來說仍然是相當漂亮的，龐大、精細、風格獨特的戰場，堪稱一絕的人物、武器、載具外觀，再加上炫目的攻擊特效，當玩家們將一枚救世主飛彈送到對方基地時，救世主飛彈爆破時產生的核彈級爆炸絕對會令在場的玩家們熱血沸騰、腎上腺素上升。

Onslaught模式算是UT2004主打的特色之一，也因為這模式的出現把整個UT的玩法整個大翻盤。然後Assault模式還加入了太空飛行戰鬥關卡，以當時來說是很有趣的要素。

易開發的遊戲引擎造成網路上蜂擁而出的地圖、人物模型、突變模組以及遊戲模組，整個遊戲的延伸性簡直是幾近無限的廣泛，讓UT2004的耐玩度可以說是完美無缺。

毫無疑問的，UT2004的表現已經超越了原本在各方面就已經趨於完美的UT99。其華麗的畫面、毫無冷場的音效、多變且傑出的遊戲模式、幾近無限延伸的可發展性，如此完美的表現還讓它榮登2004年國外最佳連線射擊遊戲的寶座，就算當年面臨DOOM3、Far Cry以及HL2等強敵依然不減其威風。

用「完美的FPS遊戲」這一詞來作UT2004的總評，可以說一點也不誇張。

15116344.review:
DISCLAIMER: If anyone notices I left out UT2003 completely, there's a point to that, and that point is likely parallel to why it only took a single year for another UT to come out.

What can I say about this game? The Steam hours say nothing about how much time I've actually put into this game. I first bought it a day after it was released in Canada (That would be about 4 weeks after it was released in the US, based on exchange rates at the time), which would have been when I was 15 or 16 years old. I'm nearly 27 now, and I still hold many fond memories with this game, and will continue to make great memories. It doesn't often see a lot of replay, but the once or twice a year I do jump back into it, I stick to it for at LEAST a week before moving on. That says a lot for an 11 year old game. A lot of other games that age I just can't jump back into because it's just too outdated for me. That, or I've grown up enough to realize that the game actually sucks balls.

UT2004 is an FPS, and like the name says, you're in a Tournament setting. You get points for "frags" (kills), capturing flags, holding positions, or whatever else depending on game type. The game is won when either team, or individual player in Deathmatch, reaches a certain goal parameter set by the campaign, yourself in Instant Action, or the Servermaster in Multiplayer. For example, in a Team Deathmatch game, the goal is always going to be the team with the most points collectively. This can be either a set limit, or it can be a timer countdown in which the team with the most frags at the end of the timer wins. The best part of this game, though, is HOW you get your frags. Even in the vanilla game, there are at least a dozen weapons to choose from. For the most part, these weapons are ranged, but there are one or two melee weapons (Who wants to use those, though?). I don't want to spoil the fun for those who are new to the game, so I'll tell you about my favourite: The flak cannon. This weapon was in the original Unreal Tournament, as well, and in it's return, it's packing a meaner punch. Here's what it does: The primary fire throws a dozen or more slugs of white-hot shrapnel at fast speed, ripping your oponent to shreds. Use this fire up close, and like a shotgun, you're bound to make it messy. The secondary fire is more of a mortar, in which the shrapnel is launched still encased, and then explodes into shrapnel on impact. Imagine taking that out in Call of Duty. 

I have to be super honest, I've never actually fully completed the actual TOURNAMENT (The "campaign" of the game), but I was never really looking for that when I bought the game. I had spent the previous five years playing Unreal Tournament, and 99.2% of that time was playing Practice Sessions, or in the case of UT2004, Instant Action. This is, in my opinion, the Brains of the game. Instant Action is where all the experimentation unfolded. Anything that you downloaded or created yourself was first tested in Instant Action, where it was put to the test with or against computer AI bots. The bots in this game are incredibily intelligent, and also very customizable. To find out more, and there's a LOT more about Instant Action, play the game and experiment yourself. It won't ever get old.

When it comes to modability, that's where UT is the most memorable. You get the basic package, which is amazing on it's own and has hundreds of hours of gameplay, but then you also get FULL modability of the game. They even include a full UTEditor where ANYONE can jump in and make maps, good or bad, mods, skins, sounds, graphics, textures, ANYTHING. It's one of the most awesome things I've seen when it comes to a game. And then those who aren't so good with game editing could easily just check community hubs and sites for content. This was what DLC was before it was corporatized and had a price slapped on it for good measure. This is how it still SHOULD be, and I'm glad Steam came up with the workshop. I'm happy there are still a lot of good developers who provide open modability, as well. I just don't see it in this scope anymore. UTEditor was relatively simple (For those who are into it) and basically right there for you to curiously click on and figure out. To put it in perspective, I was creating maps and doing minor mods to UT99 when I was 12. 

That's about all I can muster for UT2004 right now. There's WAY too much to really rave about, and I don't want to talk circles around anyone. HIGHLY recommend this game. 9.5/10

UT2004 is one of the best games ever.   Onslaught, Invasion, and even standard DM are all quite fun.  One of the very best things about the game that keeps it fresh today are all the great maps, characters, mutators and mods that you can use.  All 100% FREE. User made DLC is the best.

14658366.review:
[h1]One of my best early PC Gaming memories[/h1]
UT2004 was one of the 1st shooters I ever played, along side Call of Duty 1. I used to meetup with friends at a LAN Cafe most weekends and play it before I ever had a PC of my own.

I picked it up on steam & still love it. 
Graphics still look good enough to this day and pretty much the way I remember them which is often not the case when returning to a game years later, Gameplay/ gunplay is perfect, AI is quite good and somewhat of a balanced challenge. 
The Campaign is tons of fun and has many different game modes. My favorite being Assault, an attack & defend objective game mode. There are powerups and different abilities that you can obtain from getting max adrenaline such as Speed, Regenerate, Invisibility, Berserk, Pint-Size & Camouflage. 

There are loads of mods such as the original Alien Swarm & Killing Floor. Theres was also a mod I played but I cant remember the name, You started on a roof with fences on both sides and a spiral stair case going down into a lab, Only weapon you had was a translocator & bullpup machine gun. You could set the number of AI players & glitchy zombies. AI would run down and you'd hear over the radio (we're under attack, man down) etc. 2Spooky4me :S

Definitely try it out if your a fan of Fast paced Shooters.

14634751.review:
Unreal Tournament 2004
9 / 10 (2004)

When released in 2004 this was the third iteration in the seminal Unreal Tournament franchise. Renowed for intense and over the top deathmatch in single player and multiplayer mode, this game delivered unprecedented adrenaline overload and cumulative sleep deprivation following installation to your hard drive. 

I installed this game (2015) and played single player mode on a W7Pro 64bit / Radeon 6870 without any hassles and no 3rd party DRM. I reconfigured my keys in game to my traditional FPS set up and was fragging away within minutes, and then came the adrenaline, I loved it. This was my first time playing this particular release; the controls are responsive, the weapons (10) balanced and very tight, and the giblets abound. I played for an hour on maximum graphics quality without a single hiccup. I did not test multiplayer.

Previous versions that I have owned and played extensively include Unreal Tournament, Unreal Championship (Xbox), Unreal Tournament GOTY (2000 PC / XP), and  Unreal Tournament 3 (2007 PC / XP). This version fits perfectly in the expected rank of the series for graphics, map design, and audio quality which of course was top notch for 2004. This Hall of Fame franchise belongs in everybodies collection.

Q: Why did I install this game? 
A: They added cards. It's madness ; ) 
[note: I purchased this in 2010 in a bundle, not just for the cards!]

Buy this game Unreal Tournament 2004 if you want to taste classic deathmatch style with polished maps and gameplay from this era. 

Purchase Unreal Tournament 3 (2007) if you want more recent graphics with much larger and better maps, improved graphics and more complex gameplay options.

Addendum 
From wikipedia (PC release dates)
Unreal Tournament (1999)
Unreal Tournament 2003 (2002)
Unreal Tournament 2004 (2004) *
Unreal Tournament 3 (2007)
Unreal Tournament 4 (2015 pre-alpha)

13650440.review:
Pull your friends together, put up a private server, and play the heck out of this game.

I only recommend UT2k4 if you have a group of people to play with. Singleplayer can be a lonely experience, and the last time I checked I found the public multiplayer scene to be underpopulated. If you do find a server, you had better be skilled.

If you decide to pick up UT2k4, I have some mod recommendations for you:

- Get the first two Community Bonus Packs (CBP1 & CBP2). Together, they comprise three volumes of the best maps that the UT2k4 community produced.

- Pick up the Ballistic Weapons mod, by Runestorm. It provides an overhaul of the game's weapons and mechanics, and it serves as a nice diversion from vanilla.

- Also, check out the Fraghouse Invasion mod. Its maps might not be as pretty as the Community Bonus Packs, but it's great fun,

Have a great time!

13636968.review:
Je ne me suis jamais autant éclaté sur un FPS. J'avais déjà joué à UT 3 sur console (blasphème absolu, j'en conviens) mais celui-là est à un tout autre niveau. Déjà, il y a des options qui me font vraiment craquer comme la possibilité de changer la voix de l'annonceur, et de mettre celle d'UT99 (je suis fan inconditionnelle de cette voix). Le nombre de maps est hallucinant, les musiques sont superbes et le solo est un plaisir à jouer. Les graphismes sont vraiment un plaisir pour les yeux. Bien que ça aie dix ans, je trouve ça vraiment beau et surtout pour les standards de l'époque. Les armes sont originales et c'est ce qui fait le force d'UT en général par rapport à pas mal de FPS plus connu où c'est juste fusil d'assaut, sniper etc. Là, c'est vraiment vaste comme arsenal : ça va du fusil toxique au RPG en passant par un fusil link dont je suis totalement fan. Les tirs secondaires sont tout bonnement géniaux, et donne un côté d'autant plus stratégique au jeu.
Je recommande à tous ceux qui ont un peu d'argent à mettre dans un FPS de se diriger vers ce classique intemporel, le rapport qualité-prix étant tellement élevé que je l'ai retrouvé dans la stratosphère.

This game will never become obsolete and will remain in my heart forever. I advise it to anyone.

13611262.review:
Успех оригинальной игры Unreal Tournament был очень большим и естественно разработчики сели за создание сиквела UT. В начале 2002 года стали появляться первые подробности готовящегося хита. Обещали новый движок, скелетную анимацию, новые расы, развитый сингл-плеер, возможность управлять транспортными средствами. Вообщем планы были монструозные. В финальной версии Unreal Tournament 2003 мы некоторых обещаний так и не увидели. Сюжет не блестал не какими красками, так как опять просто сводился к проходящему турниру UT где нужно подняться по турнирной лестнице, и в конце сразиться с чемпионом тернира Малкольмом. Но зато дали возможность в одиночном режиме собирать свою команду и вместе с ней проходить уровни один за другим. Режимы в игре были Deathmatch - обычный бой друг против друга, Team Deathmatch - командный бой, Double Domination - командный режим, в котором каждая команда должна удержать обе контрольные точки (А и B) в течение 10 секунд, за что получает очки. Bombing Run - две команды играют в некое подобие регби. Целью является донести «мяч», лежащий в центре карты, до ворот соперника. Удачный выстрел «мячом» в ворота соперника приносит команде 3 очка, за прыжок в ворота вместе с «мячом» присуждается 7 очков. «Мяч» можно перекидывать другим игрокам. Главная сложность заключается в том, что пока «мяч» на руках, невозможно использование какого-либо другого оружия. Если игрок убит, «мяч» остается на месте. И Capture the Flag  — командный режим, главной целью которого является захват вражеского флага, который нужно донести до своей базы. Примечательно, что пользование транслокатором приводит к потере флага. Внутри команды можно распределять роли, такие как захват вражеского флага или охрана собственного.
Игра понравилась игрокам и Epic games и Digital Extrimes в марте 2004 года выпускают ещё один сиквел UT 2004. 
По сути получился тот же UT 2003 только улучшенный и обросший новыми возможностями, режимами, картами, персонажами и.т.д.
Новые режимы - Mutant — один из игроков становится ведущим (mutant) и его задача как можно дольше продержаться в таком состоянии.
 Ведущий имеет огромный боезапас и имеет множество бонусов (повышенная скорость перемещения, стрельбы, увеличение
 наносимого ущерба), но со временем теряет здоровье. Убивший ведущего сам становится таковым. Игрок, у которого меньше всего очков
, объявляется Bottom Feeder. Он может атаковать не только мутанта, но и других игроков. Если мутант убивает игрока, то у него на долю возрастает жизнь.
Last Man Standing — при старте всем игрокам доступно все оружие. Количество жизней ограничено. Цель игры: остаться последним игроком на арене или достигнуть лимита очков (фрагов).
Arena Master (присутствует в Unreal Tournament 2004 Ludicrous Edition) — Матч делится на несколько раундов. Один респаун за раунд,  если вы победите всех соперников, то вы получаете очки и начинается следующий раунд.
Вернулся Assault («штурм») из оригинала — в первом раунде одна из команд должна выполнить набор целей (напр. уничтожение определённых объектов) за определённое время, другая пытается это предотвратить. Затем, во втором раунде, команды меняются ролями. Побеждает команда, выполнившая большее число заданий за наименьшее время.
Onslaught («наступление») — самый масштабный режим игры, где две команды пытаются любым образом захватить энергетические точки (power nodes) с применением оружия и транспортных средств, чтобы соединить их с ядром (power core) противника и уничтожить его.
Invasion («вторжение») — все игроки объединяются для противостояния появляющимся на карте монстрам, знакомым игрокам по серии Unreal. Игра может закончиться, если все игроки погибнут. Всего игрокам необходимо выдержать 16 волн.
И это ещё не все рижимы, так как они варируются в зависисмоти от настроек игры. Сюжет опять про турнир и рас стало ещё больше участвующих в нём.
Из оружия в отличии от оригинала добавили Lightning Gun, Mine layer, Sticky Grenade Launcher, AVRiL, Ion Painter, Target Painter, Super Shock Rifle.
В основном же Epic games не далеко ушло от канонов серии, преобразив их новыми особеностями, которые используются во многих современных сетевых шутерах.
UT 2003 и 2004 были выпущены на движке Unreal Engine 2 на котором были выпущены такие игры как Postal 2, XIII, Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon 2, SWAT 4, Killing Floor, Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell

13404930.review:
Unreal Tournament 2004 lo considero uno de los mejores videojuegos de disparos más adictivos que puedan existir en la PC. Es muy entretenido y te hace pasar horas y horas jugando mientras vas superando los diferentes retos que te ponen al jugarlo en modo campaña. Es un juego ideal para que te vicies jugando con amigos en una LAN o partidas privadas por internet. En este juego la palabra "Campear" practicamente no existe porque la batalla a disparos con diferentes clases de armas te exigen que te muevas de manera muy habilidosa hacia distintos lados evitando los ataque de tu oponente. De por sí te digo que si campeas en este juego, te vuelves presa fácil. El juego cuenta con una gran variedad de mapas, armas, vehículos y habilidades que son de gran ayuda para el combate.
 
Unreal Tournament 2004 tiene sus puntos negativos, pero aún así no impiden que sea un juego bastante recomendable para jugar.

Contras:

* Poco argumenta una historia para el modo campaña.

* Hay muy poca gente conectada en los servidores multiplayer.

* Para jugar online el juego te pide que crees un nombre de usuario y una contraseña para subir las estadisticas de juego a la página de http://ut2003stats.epicgames.com/ la cual ya no existe o ha dejado de estar en servicio.

* El juego no tiene audio en español. (Las voces vienen en inglés. Menús, textos y subtítulos en español).

12251877.review:
Unreal Tournament is a classic franchise, one of the founding forefathers of the first person shooting genre.  UT2004 is no exception, it adds to the great formula that set the foundation and improves on it with better graphics, smoother gameplay and easy to add new mods and maps to the game, extending lifespan by years.

UT2004 also has a great multiplayer aspect, if you can still find servers.

Oh, and I do NOT recommend getting the Steam Version, as there is a fatal glitch that corrupts the configuration file in this game.  The CD version is cheap and generally more reliable than the digital version. Sorry Steam, but when you give us a broken game for 15 bucks, it's gonna get panned.

Still, UT2004 is a great FPS Arena shooter game.

12238622.review:
I have played over 5000 hours in this game since its release. Started off with vehicle Capture The Flag (vCTF) and then moving into the Team Arena Master (TAM) mod. Due to the age of the game, you are unlikely to find a large number of populated servers, however you should be able to find a large number of TAM ones about. The premise of TAM are two teams (5v5 usually) start a round, with a standard set of weapons, with the aim of being the last team standing. First team to get 10 rounds wins. Very simple, but extremely fun.


If this game had a playerbase like it did at release, I would still be playing. Keep an eye out on the horizon for UT4.

12227220.review: It's old (over 10 years) and the multiplayer is full of hackers, but singleplayer is pretty darn fun. 12179088.review:
Even after all these years, UT04 not only holds up both in terms of gameplay, but is actually better than most current offerings. There are 2 main reasons for this: Simple but timeless gameplay, and massive amounts of content. 

Games like this remind us all of the sad state of the current games industry. This game was released in a era where people expected their games to have content. There was no DLC. And oh boy, does this game have meat on it's bones. Yes it does, with huge amounts of maps, many different game modes, and even a single player tournament mode where you put together a team and fight other teams thus giving a sense of progression in what would otherwise be just a simple arena shooter.  

The graphics also actually hold up pretty well. This is largely because the graphic style is a bit cartoonish and very colorful, and thus it doesn't fall into the trap of "not looking realistic anymore" like so many other games do.

For 15 bucks, there is no reason not to recommend this game. 

10/10.

[h1]La licence classique des FPS[/h1]

Bien sûr, Quake en fait parti également, mais les UT en général représente une référence et un must-have pour tout les fans de FPS sur ordinateur. Cet opus est sûrement l'un des meilleurs de la licence. Il fonctionne sur des toute petite configuration comme sur des grosses.
Les nombreuses cartes et mods que la communauté produit permettent de faire perdurer l'expérience et ce, sans fin. Le nombre de partie en ligne permet de le prouver. Le jeux est sortie depuis plus de 10 ans et pourtant, il reste extrêmement actif.

Un achat que vous ne pourrez regretter donc. A acheter les yeux fermés.

11851927.review:
Unreal Tournament 2004: Alla luce dei fatti Unreal Tournament 2004 non ha deluso le aspettative e si propone come un degno successore all'edizione 2003. Epic e Digital Extremes sono riusciti a migliorare la loro "creatura" senza stravolgerla, potenziando quanto di buono avevamo già visto nel predecessore.
Le aggiunte sono consistenti, basti pensare alle dieci modalità di gioco ora disponibili, e la varietà generale è davvero tanta per essere descritta solo in poche parole. L'ottimo level design delle nuove mappe per il multiplayer aggiunge nuovi spunti sia alla giocabilità generale del titolo che alla notevole "bellezza visiva".
Questo UT 2004 non si è rivelato un semplice up-grade, come molti si aspettavano, ma è dotato di una propria anima, grazie anche alle numerose aggiunte inserite dai programmatori. Il loro sforzo non è stato nullo e possiamo affermare con certezza che questa ennesima versione del torneo di Unreal è giocabilissima e longeva a livelli stellari. Se amate il genere degli Fps Arena Unreal Tournament 2004 non deluderà le vostre aspettative. Voto finale: 9

PRO:
-Divertimento alle stelle
-Tantissime modalità presenti
-Molte armi

CONTRO: 
-I veicoli nel Multiplayer (secondo me) non sono molto utili
-Può provocare dipendenza !!!

11101605.review:
The name says it all.

UT2004 is an online shooter that was meant to show off the power of Unreal Engine 2.  It definitely accomplished its goal. If you don't want to play an online game, there's still Tournament and Instant Action modes (not to mention LAN).  The AI is great, there's a lot of diverse weapons, gamemodes, VEHICLES, and maps for you to play.

As for gameplay, for most of the time, it's like a Quake Live that doesn't suck.  There's no rocket jumping, sadly; there's plenty of physics/ragdolls, gibbing/messy shredding, and flicking off aliens to make up for it.  Just as a heads up, UT3 was pathetic compared to this.  More than that, play this one and its graphics will still be on par with other games (it just doesn't have HDR/Bloom, that's all).

Most of the time, you run around the map trying to take down as many enemies as you can while running from medkit to medkit.  The rest of the time, you use the Flak Cannon to maximize your trolling capacity and instantly win the game.

EDIT: The MP is still functional, as it turns out.  Epic shifted all of the UT games over to their own 3rd party servers.

11049116.review:
Unreal Tournament 2oo4 оставляет смешанные чувства. С одной стороны это наследник традиций старого доброго Unreal,с другой это нечто иное! В этой игре видно как разработчики пытались сохранить всё старое и доброе, что уже успело сложиться за 5 лет,но в то же время они пытались придумать что то новое,хотели быть изобретателями и дать публике нечто свежее!И как вы думаете у них получилось? Да,у них все вышло. Игра прекрасно сбалансирована,осталось все за что фанаты полюбили эту игру в далеком 1999 и появилось кое-что новенькое, что привлекло современную публику!Разработчики оставли старые виды оружия(правда не все и это маленький минус),но стараясь это компенсировать они ввели в игру новые виды оружия,новые карты(сохранив при этом закаленные в боях старрые карты),старых персонажей(Malcolm,Xen,Brock и.т.д),все режимы игры остались,но с добавлением новых режимов не менее интересных(Bombing Run,Вторжение,мутант,Last man Standing);Графика замечательная Unreal Engine 2.5 выдает красивую картинку до сих пор!Атмосфера на катртах все такая же просит тебя остаться там и забыть о реальном мире!Замечательный наследник традиций не перестающий удивлять!
9/10

10122693.review:
Many a day of my life was lost playing this game as an early teen. I returned to it now, 7 years later and it still smokes any non-military (meaning not in the vein of CS, Battlefield etc.) competitive shooter out there.

As AlexOfSpades put it, "before the days of shooters that holds your hand and aim for you, that regenerate your health and show you what to do like a baby, there was this." Yes indeed. I have gotten so accustomed to these games that, when I bought this game and went straight to my old habit of a warm-up Masterful bot DM, I had my ASS HANDED TO ME. Time. And Time. Again. Until my rusty inner gaming beast finally tossed away the awful crutches that today's games forced upon it and I once again felt the rush of a full-blown UT deathmatch.

This shows what a bunch of wimps today's "fast-paced shooters" are made for. This game requires insane concentration, mental sharpness, quick decision making and finger/fine motorics coordination of a freaking Navy jet pilot. Stand still - dead, wrong weapon for the situation - dead, miss a powerup - dead, let the enemy pick up a health pack - dead, shoddy tactics in team matches - dead. No room for error (providing you have set the difficulty level high enough to actually be challenged). It's a wild ride and there is no better feeling than finally letting go of your poor, burned-out mouse and seeing your username at the top of the scoreboard.

Technically, the game excels at everything. The weapons are perfectly balanced, the powerups are perfectly distributed, the gameplay is smooth and uninterrupted. The graphics are 2004 appropriate, but even today, they are a thing of beauty, the colors are clear and it doesn't have the murky, gray/brown "drape" like UT3. The only thing that kind of bugged me was no native widescreen support, but the fix is super easy, no problems there.

However, as much as I can gush over the "old days" of adrenaline-fuelled arena bloodshed, it's dated. Not the game itself, as I said, it is arena mayhem at its most perfect, but the concept itself has sadly fallen out of fashion. There will always be devout maniacs such as myself and a lot of people who gave this game a thumbs up, but ultimately, I think there's little hope of this kind of action coming back in this form.

Long story short: if you spent days trying to find a tactic to bring down a Power Core in a certain map, or spent days honing your no-scope headshots, get this, and feel the rush. If you're a modern gamer new to this game, get it, take it easy at first, up the difficulty when you feel you have the grasp, and realize that CoD is about as intense as PacMan. If you're expecting to get your mind blown by anything other than a Flak Cannon, don't get this game. This is nothing new. It is something old. And it still kicks gobs of ass.

Galardonado juego basado en las poco conocidas fiestas tradicionales del pueblo de Camporrobles, en la que los humildes campesinos y agricultores celebraban partidos a muerte con lanzacohetes durante 10 minutos cada tarde de fin semana.

Así el modo historia del juego nos pone en el lugar de Cecilio Camperruiz, recién llegado al pueblo y novato en las artes del lanzacohetismo, en el que se hará un nombre propio cuando nosotros lo hagamos ascender a través de las listas de los mas hábiles en el bello arte del linkspamming y el nonscope. Una bella historia en la que la tensión, leucemia y masturbación prepuber están a la orden del día en este frenético shooter con las participaciones de celebridades como Belén Esteban en el papel de la princesa del pueblo y Jesucristo como Galactus.

9602811.review:
Aaaah Unreal Tournament. L'un de mes multijoueurs préféré de très loin. Après avoir joué pendant longtemps au premier (le 99) et au 2003 en CD, cet opus me surprend par ses nouveautés.
Autant le passage au 2003 a énormement changé le jeu avec les personnages, les modes ainsi que les maps grâce aux nouveaux graphismes, autant celui-là perfectionne l'idée avec des nouveaux personnages, des paramètres plus complètes (dont certaines fortement appréciables comme le temps de respawn après mort), de nouvelles maps et de nouveaux modes.
Mes deux coups de coeur ont été inéluctablement les nouveaux modes: le mode Onslaught et le retour du mode Assaut ! (ce dernier n'étant pas dans le 2003)
Beaucoup de nouvelles maps sont des créations inofficielles qui ont été ajouté au jeu (je dis ça en connaissance de cause pour en avoir téléchargé beaucoup lorsque je jouais au 2003) et j'ai eu la surprise de voir certaines mutators inofficielles également. Les puristes trouveront leur bonheur grâce aux mutators et paramètres permettant de retrouver certains skins, détails et méchanismes des anciens UT.
Enfin, le tournois s'avère bien amélioré: la création et gestion d'équipe est beaucoup plus simple et intelligente, un système d'argent a été mis en place pour le choix des coéquipiers et missions selon notre niveau, le mode de difficulté Initié a été supprimé mais l'IA a été complexifié de manière générale et les nouvelles maps sont bien évidemment mise en avant.
Le point noir est la qualité des IA alliés, que je trouve stupides par rapport à l'ennemi. Ce qui handicape assez dans les modes de difficulté qui demandent une bonne coordination (dans le cas où vous jouez avec les bots et en tournois).
Pour conclure, je conseille avidemment ce nouvel opus aux connaisseurs qui y trouveront le même grand plaisir à fraguer que dans les deux premiers, ainsi qu'à ceux qui n'ont pas encore eu la chance de découvrir la saga Unreal Tournament. Cousin de Quake, ce multi aux divers modes est très fréquenté sur internet et qu'importe votre préférence pour le PvP, vous maintiendra en haleine dans des carnages frénétiques avec des bots énervés !

9535852.review:
Every game comes with its positives and negatives. That being said, I think this game is one of the greatest games made to date! I absolutely love it! Epic Games and their engine really did create what I'd consider a masterpiece that is UT2k4. Originally, I got introduced to the Unreal series through the predecessor UT2k3 when I was just a little kid and I almost instantly fell in love with the game. My family was fairly poor at the time, so they could never afford to buy me the game, so I had to get a pirated copy to play. Once 2k4 came out, I loved the even greater variety of game modes that it had to offer as well as the old game modes that were only offered in UT99 at the time. As soon as I started working and made a steam account, I bought Unreal Tournament 2004 because I really do think it's well worth its price. Heck, I even bought it for a few of my close friends for them to play too just because the Unreal series NEEDS to be known, or at least I think it should be. I'll start out with the positives and the things I love about this game.

Positives:
- Multiple multiplayer game modes
- Very different difficulty levels of AI's that do test your skill well, or can help you learn easily
- Generally strong, polite, dedicated community (I've met moderators of maps that still hang around ever since the game launched!)
- Immersive and very well balanced gameplay
- Fast paced
- Challenging (In all honesty, I think this game truly tests your weapon handling skills in terms of shooter games)
- Fun community game mods and a very well done game editing kit
- Competitive
- Satisfying gameplay
- Many gaming and option features
- Character design is fresh and different, many maps to play on, and large gun variety (as well as some sweet vehicles too!)

Negatives:
- Arena shooters aren't as popular as they used to be
- Graphics are outdated (Who cares?)
- The rare but occasional hacker

Honestly, for me, the negatives don't even hold a candle to the overall game and my rating for it is an easy 10/10
That being said, if you want to test your shooting, dodging, reaction time and/or any other skills I highly recommend this game!

Множество карт, оружия, увлекательные режимы, а также долгожданная возможность рассекать необъятные игровые просторы на машинах делают эту игру однозначным приобретением для всех, кто ценит качество и увлекательность. 9279075.review:
This is THE game that got me into gaming, I was 9 when I started playing it in 2004 and I still come back every now and then to play some good 'ol Unreal.

Almost every game-mode is fun and well designed, they range from regular old Deathmatch to Capture the Flag with Ion-Canon tanks and Jeeps with blades on them, invasion was always my favorite, it was so well designed in fact that games like Killing Floor were born from it.
The weapons are also a blast to use, PC Gamer even crowned Unreal's 'Flak Cannon' the best gun in PC gaming, but it doesn't end there, the are plasma and laser guns to mess around with, but you also have your trusty old rocket launcher and even a steerable mini-nuke. If you don't like messing around with such a huge arsenal you can play with an Instagib instead, which is a slow-firing weapon with 100% accuracy that instantly kills (and gibs, as the name suggests) anything you hit with it.

Another thing that made it so vastly different from all the boring arena shooters we have nowadays was the crazy mobility, you could do double jumps or jump against a wall and then jump from there again, leading to some pretty hectic but awesome gameplay, you could enable a handy little device called the Translocator that allowed you to shoot a disc and teleport to it with a simple click, making camping virtually impossible.

The game has tons of maps from itself, but Unreal has a very lively modding community and thus hunderds of maps for every game-mode are available for download, you can also download costum skins and even entirely new weapons, just a shame that the game has no steam-workshop.

Even though the game is pretty old by now, there's still a reasonable amount of people playing this gem, if you want to play one of the best sci-fi shooters on the market I'd suggest giving this one a go (And not Unreal Tournament 2007, it didn't live up to the standard of the Unreal franchise in my opinion).

9232615.review: The way to success lies through failures, and only those who doesn't fear critics, will master this road. Unreal Tournament 2004 — not simply doubled number of the cards, new textures, game modes and tons of pleasant trifles. It is attempt to grope the style lost in motley UT 2003 tinsel and to get back to the ideas which in due time have made the best-seller the first UT; fruit of two years' evolution, thoughtful studying of responses and careful introduction of new concepts. Certainly, about any aspiration to start everything with a clean slate the speech doesn't go — UT 2004 at least on two thirds consists of old materials. Well familiar modes are attached to thoroughly propatchenny frame of the previous version — дефматч usual, дефматч command, CTF, Double Domination, Last Man Standing and Bombing Run, and 50 of 106 available cards already "stayed" in UT 2003 and free a bonus-pakakh from Epic/Digital Extremes. Copied them not blindly — the levels which design caused special complaints, are changed or processed, and the balance of forces got rid of lameness. So, the spring ability of players decreased and "adrenalinic tablets" fell in price, adding now on only two units "is flown into a rage". But after all game should be tried, I advise all! (This my opinion and it can not coincide with yours).

8794627.review:
С этой игрой у меня связан целый этап жизни. Если бы она была у меня сразу в стиме, то я уверен, что наигранных часов у меня было бы точно где то 5000+. Начал играть в 2007 году и плотно играл до 2012. Играл по 3-4 часа в день. Каждый день. А иногда и по все 7-9. Вот же были времена ).
Сейчас игра уже не так заводит как раньше. Играю 3 мапы в один месяц и мне хватает за глаза. Это всё потому что обстановка в игре сильно изменилась. Постараюсь объяснить почему.

Если в далёком прошлом можно было видеть такие картины:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=218837634
то сейчас это просто не возможно. 10 игроков на сервере - это уже радость неописуемая. Играют лишь в TAM и iCTF. Только на серверах в этих режимах ещё как то сохраняется дух старой школы. В DM уже почти не играют, народу очень мало. А про VCTF уже и подавно почти все забыли...

Вообще, 22 февраля 2012 года - официальная дата закрытия. Именно в этот день была закрыта целая сеть самых популярных серверов - iTS. В этот день, один тип из америки окончательно взломал и достал админа iTS. Он его полностью деморализовал. И тогда админ решил закрыть дело, которое было очень популярным в течении 3х лет. Было много слёз. В последний день, на форуме была создана тема в которой сотни игроков приходили и просто писали последние слова мол было всё очень весело и хорошо и как же жалко, что всё закончилось именно так.

[h1]Достоинства[/h1]
1. Геймплей то что надо для меня, ближе всего мне подходит. Не медленно как в контре, но и не быстро как в квейке (или Крутом Сэме). Никакого разброса пуль, куда выстрелил - туда пуля и летит. Никакого глупого рандома, всё решает скилл. Броня крепко защищает, никто не убьёт одной пулей через всю карту. Также есть доджи - главное отличие от всех конкурентов.
2. Разнообразие режимов игры. Но я всегда отдавал предпочтение DM и VCTF.
3. Добавлены стим карточки. Не дешёвые, особенно метал. Жаль, что не добавили ещё и Стим ачивки, как это было в UT3. Вот это был бы прекрасный стимул вернуться в родные стены.

[h1]Недостатки[/h1]
1. Игра мёртвая. Народу крайне мало. Играют всегда одни и те же. Заходя на любой сервер, можно быть уверенным, что с этим игроком ты играл вчера и будешь играть завтра... Серверов не больше. Думаю из популярных (на которых есть игроки, а не боты) - их всего не более 20.
2. Мастерство игроков очень высокое. Новичкам тут нечего ловить. Да и если самому подолгу не играть, то скилл довольно быстро начинает падать.
Для наглядности: в 2009 году подобные трюки были дефицитом и кто их делал - был Богом. Сейчас же это норма и умеет делать более половины игроков.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=194979962
3. Технически игра сделана ужасна. Но для 2004 года - это ещё простительно. 
» Неткод плохой. Если пинг выше 50 (без уткмопа) - то играть невозможно, задержка ощутимо чувствуется. Нужно играть на серверах, где установлен уткомп - только с ним можно играть с высоким пингом.
» Защиты от читеров - нету. Анти тсс также бесполезен, как и VAC в Стиме. Ловит лишь очевидных читеров.
» Из-за понятия демо ключ "32af..." - идёт неразбериха в меню поиска серверов, там всё сложно и не удобно до безумия. Заходить лучше через "избранное".
4. Графика реально устарела. Сейчас прям противно на неё смотреть. Пустые голые стены окружают со всех сторон. Стандартные карты практически не играют, а они то явно красивее и оптимизированы как надо. Гоняют самопал, которого подавляющее большинство.
5. Никаких таблиц лидеров или же ранговой составляющей. 

Вывод: игра превосходная, но её время прошло, к великому сожалению, 10 из 10.
Сильно жду Unreal Tournament 4, на него вся надежда, что оживит некогда успешную серию!

8634951.review:
Sit down, son. You just stumbled upon the page of the best shooter ever made. Pay some respect. 

Before the days of shooters that holds your hand and aim for you, that regenerate your health and show you what to do like a baby, there was this. Unreal Tournament 2004 - the most brutal, adrenalin-fueled shooter since Quake 3 Arena, a game so fast-paced its guaranteed you'll burn your eyes from not blinking for so long. They say we only use 20% of our brains - well, if you play this game on the hardest difficulty, you'll be using 100% i assure you. Holy hell son, this game uses so much of your brain it pretty much even cures autism. This game is filled with so much testosterone you have to shave your beard every forty minutes of gametime.

Gameplay wise, this game is delicious. With an amazing arsenal of creative, varied and badass weapons, its certified there is a gun for everyone and every situation - sniper rifles that shoot lightning bolts, a triple rocket launcher, jesus christ did i mention a shotgun that shoots grenades too? (The Flak Cannon, considered the number 1 best gun of all times by PC Gamer). Also, with the ability of limitless dodging, walljumping and even double-jumping, the potential for amazing acrobatic moves to evade your enemy's attacks are so great not even Dante from Devil May Cry can keep up. Yep: he cries every night because he cant be as badass as you, when you're playing this game. But this is the bare basic - to survive in the Online arenas, you better be backflipping over your enemies and giving them an instagib headshot while upside down. That's how you play this. However, to be good you have to have absolute keyboard coordination and aiming abilities - it aint easy to do those moves while scoring headshots airborne. Its so hardcore, they say ninjas have to play this game to graduate in Ninja School as their last test. I'm not even kidding. 

The maps are varied, from skyscrapers reaching space and low-grav to gothic dungeons, futuristic egyptian pyramids to spaceships blasting in hyperspace - there are over 140 maps in this game (thats almost 5 times more than any CoD), ranging from Deathmatch maps to Capture the Flag, Double Domination, Onslaught (Battlefield-esque map node domination), Assault (from the original UT) and even Bombing Run (Its soccer. WITH GUNS). And kid, that's not even taking into account the thousands of maps released by fans - that's right, the modding community is huge for this game. (No DLC crap, no. You get all those maps and access to mod maps for free. Welcome to oldschool shooters)

The soundtrack and graphics certainly do not falter. We get badass tracks like the one in DM-Asbestos, and others have more epic orchestral music (for actual epic scenes: assaulting an alien mothership to save Earth) and the graphics, for their time, were considered to be amazing (Even modern games, like Killing Floor, use this game engine as base). The visual and audio presentation certainly do not lack, but to this day this game isnt known for having pretty trees, its known for being the best shooter of all times and god damn it does it right. 

Together with the classic Unreal Tournament and Quake 3 Arena, Unreal Tournament 2004 is known by shooter veterans worldwide to be the best competitive shooter experience that ever existed. Think you're ready for that? Take off the Angry Birds shirt, the Casual of Duty cap and get ready for a terrific head-hunting experience with the game that INVENTED Double-Kills, Headshots and Killing-Sprees (that all games rip-off nowadays).

Final Score: 10/10

8444736.review:
Arguably the best of the Unreal Tournament games, which seem to follow a popularity trend similar to that of the Godfather... Taken with Unreal Tournament 3, we can see the sad consequences of a gaming industry that increasingly tries to mimic the film industry (is there a real difference anymore?), though the evidence for that claim is a little more implicit between these two titles... The later has fewer maps: Unreal Tournament 2004 has 106 maps 

(http://liandri.beyondunreal.com/Unreal_Tournament_2004#Maps) 

compared to the 47 that shipped with Unreal Tournament 3

 (http://forums.epicgames.com/threads/579659-Full-UT3-Map-list)

One only needs a brain to realise this is less than half. Furthermore, UT3 spreads these maps over 8 game types compared to 10 in UT2004. Why then did UT3 Cost $60 when new, and UT2004 cost $40 despite having only 3 years between release dates? The obvious answer is, it looks better. Many more people are needed to create a new Engine than are needed to create new maps; many more people mean many more salaries to pay whilst maintaining agreeable profits.

Why should the gamer settle for less and pay more? The argument that better graphics make up for the defecit can easily be exploded by taking it to its logical conclusion: Would one pay a very large amount, say $100 or more, for a photorealistic game that lasted only several hours? If the answer to that is yes, it in turn begs the question: Why not buy a film?

Of course, very little can be done about this trend in practice; big developers will continue to develop, with teams of thousands, games that look fantastic and gross multi-million figures. These games will be short and expensive. These games will have neither pretension nor surplus content (except that that must be brought later). This should not manifest as defeatism however, and least of all complacency.  

To undermine this trend, at least in part, one can: Support indie developers by purchasing their games, and being more vocal about them, not pre-order games that promise in advance to be lack-lustre, not pay double the retail price for a bas relief tin and a pamphlet; I am talking here of Legendary Editions and so on (What is legendary about a metal case, art book and a making of... DVD?), be dubious of games released in a yearly fashion, or jack it in all together and find a new hobby.

In any case, UT2004 remains a great game in its own right. The volume of content ensures many unique experiences by definition, and the game still has a strong online aspect to be enjoyed. It is fun in the sadistic way that shooting things is, and it sets itself too few pretensions to have any serious flaws. It discarded very little from the original title and updated the graphics to the standard of the time, and it did this without skimping on the things that make a game a game, namely characters, levels and modes, showing yes- it can be done, so yes- I recommend it.

This is what a competitve shooter should be. A great game at high level skill but simple enough for casual players to join in. The surviving game modes currently are Deathmatch, CTF, and Onslaught. Onslaught is a good start for players, it does not requrie as much attention as CTF or Deathmatch; it's comparable to Titan mode in BF2142 where you have to destroy the other team's main point. 

There are a large ammount of weapons in this game, each with there own unique use. Most guns have a secondary fire, ifnot they use a zoom function.

The movement system is something that will be missed in FPS games. You have your simple Jumps and Double jumps, but then you have dodges and wall dodges. They're like a far reaching side jump, so when your about to get hit you can quickly move off to side into safety (or impending danger) faster than you would have jumping. Since you are unable to rocket jump, shield guns are used as a subsitute. The shield gun's primary can be charged up to deal a damaging wave of force in front of you to kill people who get to close or push up just a bit higher. The longer the charge the higher you can go up, but the more you get hurt.

The game is pretty much dead but if you have friends i absolutley reccomend this game, it's an experience you won't get from other shooters made today (mabey other the Quake, and Warsow)

7972065.review:
My favourite iteration of the UT series.

Vanilla UT2004 has more than enough game mods and maps to swallow up huge amounts of your time. The bots cater for every skill level and do a good job of making offline matches fun in their own right. It also has a campaign mode that lets you buy and sell players, challening other clans to matches as you head on up the league table. It was very enjoyable back in the day and I was sad When UT3 didn't have the same sort of campaign.

The game will run smoothly on all but the most basic of computers and has been a staple of LAN parties ever since its launch. It has aged brilliantly and was well supported by its community back in the day, making it worth getting for mods like 'Air Buccaneers' alone!

Before UT2004 there was a 2003 edition which was very similar. There was outcry when this version was announced, with people accusing it of becoming an annual series, much like EA sport titles. I'm almost sad that that wasn't the case, since this 2004 version contains everything that came with the 2003 edition, doubled the number of maps, added new game modes (including a very popular vehicle mode which is better balanced than I had ever expected it to be) and generally rendered the previous version of the game obsolete.

I still haven't scratched the surface of what this game contains. It's big enough that even if you only like a small fraction of what it has to offer, you'll still have more to play with than most entire games have to offer. An odd little side-note, but both girls I've shown this game to have loved it, even though they're not generally fans of aggressive, adrenaline-based frag fests. Odd.

It's a thumbs up from me. The only irritating thing about it is that occasionally matches reach a frustrating stalemate, or you begin to lose through no fault of your own which is an incredibly frustrating experience. You'd expect that in online modes but offline, when you're outperforming the bots by a considerable margin, can get very frustrating. I've hardly touched the online part of this game, it's never appealed to me. Call me a noob, but the fact this game still holds my attention should pay adequate testament to the quality of this title. UT2004: 10 games rolled into one. Fun for all the family. 'cept children, probably not suitable for them.

And guess what? Even with the game nearing the 10-year mark, it's still active! You can still find some Deathmatch and Onslaught servers with a steady community if you decide to start playing right now. A true testament to the absolute quality of this game.

7777777.review:
Fantastic game. Fast-paced, fun, requires skill, accuracy, a bit of thought, quick reflexes, and the ability to actually move around properly.

Dodge, wall-jump, and double-jump mechanics allow you to combine these in any order. They allow you to move quickly and be all over the place, making yourself hard to hit, and allow you to get across the map faster.

There are a multitude of weapons to be picked up off of the map, all of which are unique and have their own special functions, and alternate firing modes.

Hundreds of maps, most with great art-style, environments, geographical design, and music.

Being a game from 2004, the game still looks fantastic (better than many games today, unsurprisingly), and has a multitude of great bonus features.

-Press F11 and the game opens a built-in in-game music player that allows you to play any of your own, or in-game songs, instead of what the current map is playing.
-In the audio options, there is a feature that enables built-in text-to-speech for the chat and IRC areas of the game, that way you don't miss a word as your head spins on a swivel, while you are caught up in the fast-paced shooting and battles, with no time to read.

There's a ton of game modes, Deathmatch, Bombing Run, Double Domination, Assault, Team Deathmatch, Capture the Flag, Vehicle Capture the Flag, Onslaught, and many others.

Get the game, play against bots (start off on just below masterful, trust me. Just BELOW Masfterful), and have some fun. Instant action and campaign, once you find a decent community, play some online. Do NOT play sniper camping, zark (especially), or ballistic weapons mods exclusively (24/7, or primarily). Also do NOT play DM-Rankin all the time.
SUPPORT the servers that don't suck balls and have ACTUAL map rotation!

7614767.review:
Это игра моего детства. Тогда она казалась мне просто божественной. Но самое удивительное, что она и сейчас заставляет меня проводить в ней не один час подряд! 
Сочный геймплей с абсолютно разными режимами не дает скучать. Она просто не может надоесть, так как если у вас пропадет желание крошить всех в Deathmatch, то вы сможете спокойно пойти на Flag Capture или Invasion, где процесс не менее захватывающий, всего доступно 9 (!) видов состязаний.
Графический уровень не вызывает пререканий, окружениепроработанно очень качественно, как и все остальное. Драйвовый звук и саундтрек лишь сгущают эпик и преумножают его.
Особенно порадовали боты. Это вам не "опытные" дундуки из того же CS:GO, они будут рвать вас, пока вы сами не начнете играть на уровне матерого игрока. Хотя бывают иногда и глупые маневры, которые делают ботов крайне уязвимыми, но во всем остальном они будут: стрелять метко по вам; собирать на карте все, чтобы вы не могли их убить до тех пор, пока они саи к вам не добеуться и не завалят вас; тащить в любом режиме, ибо они всегда работают намного слаженнее, чем вы со своей командой ботов-истуканов.
Арсенал как всегда в духе мультиплеерных шутеров- на любой вкус. Любите валить недруга на дальней дистанции? -Для вас есть Снайперская винтовка, Молниевое ружье, ну и для тех, кто поопытнее- Шоковое ружье. Любите работать на средних дистанциях? Вам в руки Пулемет, Цепную пушку, ну и естественно то же Шоковое ружье. Для ближних дистанций может подойти все это разом, но авангардом всегда будет Осколочная пушка, Био-пушка и Ракетница. Но главное, что каждое оружие вы можете использовать как в основном , так и в альтернативном режиме.
Эти малочи и создают такую неповторимую драйвовую атмосферу этой игре.
11/10 (Сверхбал за ностальгию)

In my opinion, this is the single greatest arena first person shooter of all time. When it comes to competitive play, absolutely nothing beats this game. This game itches absolutely every desire I have for an arena shooter perfectly.

One of the biggest complaints I have with modern games on PC is a lack of features. This game features a full editing kit, great community driven content, a hub to display that content and a plethora of other features that hardly any other games have in comparison. Yes, that does include a FoV slider. The thing that all FPS games should have no matter what.

If this game were to only be available by going to E-Bay and paying $200 for it, I would in a heartbeat. If you're a fan of arena shooter games like Quake, you're really missing out if you haven't played this. If you want to try out arena shooters for the first time, this is your best choice. I have personally bought this game for a good few people simply because of how much I believe in it. Get it now.

Specific weapons and characters, solid AI, background story... If you make it work on your new 64-bit OS, it should be your preferred choice before Unreal (Tournament) 3. Verdikt: UT 2004 prekonal všetky očakávania a utíšil kritikov, ktorí si mysleli že bude po obsahovej stránke pripomínať skôr datadisk ako plnohodnotnú hru. Nové UT, čo sa týka obsahu určite nesklame, ale presne naopak milo prekvapí. Hra obsahuje cez stovku máp, desiatky postáv, nové módy a taktiež vozidlá. Mapy sú prispôsobené jednotlivým módom hry a v niektorých prípadoch sú extrémne rozľahlé. Zbrane ostali po starom, ale vylepšilo sa zorné pole vďaka zmenšeniu ich objemu. Z enginu autori vytrieskali maximum je to naozaj vidno. Oproti UT 2003 sú modeli postáv oveľa prepracovanejšie a efekty o úroveň vyššie. Atmosféra zápasov je naozaj hutná a prekonáva všetky predchádzajúce diely série. Hra nepoteší len hráčov MP, ale taktiež hráčov SP kvalitnou kampaňou. UT 2004 posunulo latku poriadne vysoko a každé ďalšie pokračovanie bude mať problémy ju prekonať.

97%

5701888.review:
The best game of all time!

Why? Because, there is a lasting desire to play this game even after having played it pretty much since it came out. I can't resist the challange, the multiplayercommunity is still active and keeps bringing me back every single day.

Back in time this game was the first in an era of game-engines where you could walk, drive and fly with a perfect experience and control. The learning curve to master weapons, movement, the surrounding and your opponent is endless. Totally different than any regurlar shooter like CS, BF or COD which are far less rich on dynamic and have a far less joy factor.

The best that this game offers is a game-editor. Make your own custimazations or download them as there is an extreme amount of wide-ranged mods available for both off and online play. The community enriched the game with content, a reason for them to love this game and a reason for them to keep playing this game. I wonder why new games don't offer such a thing as this concept has proven itself in extreme over time.

The graphics are extreme good for a game that is 10 years old. You can easily select a high resolution without seeing pixels. Maps have been designed on arena playability, not pure as a show off for the engine possibilities.

The sound is awesome as UT2004 is a game that supports digital audio. Windows XP supports digital sound, Vista and 7 do not. Windows made a recent move with Windows 8 by supporting digital sound again. Want to experience digital gamingsound yourself? You like to experience yourself why early PC gamers start watering in their mouth of digital gamesound?

The game runs flawless on any Windows version that runs Steam. Just make sure to check the guide for Windows 10.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=594282124

4723816.review:
I just bought this game during the flash sale for the sole reason of recommending it. Unfortunately, I have the 2004 original DVD version added to my account so I couldn't write a recommendation.

This is the game that shaped my initial PC multiplayer gaming experience. I've logged about 4000-5000 hours (just an estimate) in the last decade. If it wasn't for this game, I probably would have discovered PC gaming much later than I initially did. 

Moving on to the official recommendation: the single player is very simple, but holds an interesting enough story for its time. The graphics are dated, yes, but honestly I think the game still looks very aesthetically pleasing. There is a general play mode called "Instant Action" where you can choose your gamemode, and play! This includes classics like deathmatch, capture-the-flag, and newer gametypes such as Bombing Run, vCTF and more. All of which are very, very fun.

The multiplayer community was thriving from between the initial release of this game all the way up to about 1-2 years ago. The community is still somewhat active and there is a good 20 active servers out there with different gametypes to play. There are also several mods that you can download. The modding community within this game is still somewhat active, too. The UDK is also a great tool for learning to map.

I still play this game everyday, and have done since 2004 when I was only 11 years old. It is very cheap right now (and offers trading cards, so badge collectors, it's worth the buy alone for that).

This is my all-time favourite game, and if you decide to purchase it, I'll introduce you to what's left of the very tight-knit community.

Buy this game.

1159420.review:
Temos aqui o terceiro (em ordem cronológica) título da série Unreal lançado no Steam. Lançado em 2004 e que teve o Unreal Engine 2.5 como base. Um FPS frenético onde tiros de metralhadoras, foguetes, plasma e ogivas nucleares vão garantir que você não saia vivo. Agora temos a presença de veículos, mais classes e novos modos de jogo para garantir a diversão por muitas e muitas horas.

[h1][b]Avaliação:[/b][/h1]

[h1][b]Classes/Raças: 9/10[/b][/h1]
Temos poucas opções de customização de personagens, nada além de opções de rosto e cor das vestimentas, porém porém isso é mais que suficiente pois na maioria das vezes os corpos simplesmente explodem no meio da partida. Apesar disso, temos cerca de 11 raças para escolher. Não faz muita diferença, pois o importante é destruir o adversário antes que ele te destrua.

[h1][b]Modos de jogo: 10/10[/b][/h1]
Unreal Tournament 2004 traz diversos modos de jogo. Muitas horas garantidas e muita variedade para todos os gostos. Estes são alguns dos modos de jogo disponíveis:

  -[b]Onslaught[/b]: Neste modo de jogo a grande jogada é o uso de veículos, e você precisa destruir todas as bases inimigas para capturá-las em [i]link[/i], todas elas espalhadas em um mapa enorme. Capture todas as bases para ter acesso ao [i]Power Core[/i] da equipe inimiga, e destruí-lo. Há grandes conflitos concentrados em bases-chave.
  -[b]Bombing Run[/b]: Uma espécie de futebol assassino. Você tem que pegar a bola que está no meio do mapa e atirá-la no arco (gol) inimigo. Arremessando a bola você faz 3 pontos, pulando junto com ela você faz 7 pontos. A bola pode ser passada aos aliados, e é derrubada se você for morto.
  -[b]Capture the Flag[/b]: Este clássico ainda está presente. Faça pontos capturando a bandeira inimiga e levando-a até a sua.
  -[b]Double Domination[/b]: Seu time faz pontos ao capturar os 2 pontos de controle e mantê-los por 10 segundos. Cada ponto fica em um lado do mapa.
  -[b]Mutant[/b]: Uma partida Deathmatch comum, e o primeiro a morrer se torna o "mutant". Este jogador recebe munição ilimitada, camuflagem e super-velocidade, mas perde saúde com o tempo. Quando o "mutant" é morto, os poderes dele passam para quem o matou.

[h1][b]Música: 9/10[/b][/h1]
A trilha sonora do jogo é interessante, se diferencia um pouco do estilo das músicas de seu antecessor, mas continua sendo bem "animada". Ideal para um jogo frenético como este.

[h1][b]Gráficos: 10/10[/b][/h1]
Belos gráficos, muito melhorados se comparados ao Unreal Tournament anterior, agora temos mapas em vastas florestas, cavernas subterrâneas, naves espaciais, mapas submersos e até mesmo do lado de fora de naves no espaço!

[h1][b]Controles: 10/10[/b][/h1]
Os mesmos controles de um FPS comum. Algo que pode ser difícil no começo é o sistema de esquiva (apertar duas vezes rapidamente para alguma direção faz seu personagem "desviar" para aquele lado. O que também pode fazer um novo jogador se confundir são os atalhos para as armas, pois temos um total de 19 armas!

[h1][b]Arsenal: 10/10[/b][/h1]
Ah, o arsenal de UT2004 continua sendo letal e variado. Dentre as mais interessantes temos:
O Translocador, que te permite atirar um disco em qualquer lugar do mapa e se teletransportar para o local onde o disco está;
O Bio Rifle, que atira placas de lixo tóxico que grudam nas paredes e na superfície da água;
A Link Gun, um rifle que atira rajadas de plasma quente ou uma rajada contínua do mesmo;
O Flak Cannon, uma arma que atira estilhaços quente de metal nos inimigos, que ricocheteiam nas paredes;
O Rocket Launcher, dispensa comentários, lançador de foguetes que também pode lançá-los em forma de granadas temporizadas. É possível soltar até 3 foguetes ao mesmo tempo;
Redeemer, a arma mais poderosa do jogo. Lança uma ogiva nuclear com imensa área de impacto, o que garante diversos Multi-Kills. No tiro secundário, é possível controlar a ogiva com uma câmera. Apesar do poder de fogo, a Redeemer só pode carregar 1 ogiva por vez.

[h1][b]Servidores: 8/10[/b][/h1]
Temos diversos servidores com a grande maioria dos modos de jogo disponíveis ao redor do mundo, sendo assim o lag pode ser algo a atrapalhar, ainda mais num jogo com ritmo frenético como este. Apesar disso, o Single Player ainda pode ser um grande desafio nos modos de dificuldade mais avançados.

[h1][b]Nota final: 9.4/10[/b][/h1]


A série Unreal Tournament foi (e ainda é) um dos grandes pilares dos FPS, ao lado de jogos como Quake e Counter-Strike. É um FPS especialmente interessante para se jogar, pois proporciona uma experiência bem diferente da que outros jogos de tiro podem te dar. Vale muito a pena.

If you haven't played this game before, you're gay. I'm serious. WHO HASN'T PLAYED UNREAL TOURNAMENT 2004 (or 2K4).

How to play? Simple. 
Pick a character, spawn, grab a gun, attempt to kill someone, die in the process.
Rinse and repeat--you now know how to play (or suck at) UT2004. 

There's also new modes such as Onslaught / Assault for you to enjoy (UT2003 didn't have these)! Additionally, there's a ton of custom maps, skins (hot robot chicks--I'm serious) and other what me not for you to download and fill up your computer's ever so small HDD space with.

If you're a graphic whore, I suggest playing UT3, which is darker but prettier at the same time. Obviously you won't get epic weapons like the Lightning gun there, but its still worth a mention.

Yes, I enjoyed playing this game when I was a kid it is still enjoyable even up till today. 

I'll blame lag whenever I get killed during Multiplayer. But that's true anyway! Lag sucks, I don't. SELF PRAISE!

One of the best arena shooters of all time. I've logged thousands of hours playing this since it's release in 2004... Amazing game, lots of replay value, and a fuckton of fun.

Also, this game is extremely moddable, and has a very dedicated modding community, even to this day. The possibilities of expanding this game are endless. This game has spawned many great mods, such as Ballistic Weapons, ChaosUT2: Evolution, Mars Wars 3, Out of Hell, Unwheel, Gunreal, and Tripwire's mods-turned-commercial-games Killing Floor and Red Orchestra.

Speaking of modability - ever wanted to see Gordon Freeman from Half-Life, and Link from Legend of Zelda duel to the death with heavy artillery? Now you can, because Unreal Tournament 2004 has literally thousands of downloadable player skins and models you can find online.

Even the stock game has a staggering 6gb of content. Lots of awesome maps, dozens of game modes, a single player campaign, custom solo skirmishes, and much more. The re-playability of UT2004 is endless.

Lastly, If you like Unreal Tournament '99, there's even more reason to buy and play this game, as there's now a very faithful adaptation of UT99 for UT2004 known as Unreal Tournament: 2341 - http://www.moddb.com/mods/ut2341-hd-arsenal

1263434.review:
Seven years since the release of Unreal Tournament 2004, and it still stands as a paragon of the FPS genre.  Gameplay is fast and furious, but death is seldom instant, a feat rarely accomplished in today's world of a-bullet-scratched-me-take-cover health regen games.  Health and shields are static, restored only by pickups.  Ammo and weapons must be picked up and are not granted with perks.  Everything from vehicles to weapons to ammo is out in the field and just waiting to be grabbed.  And there is a great variety. 

UT2004 features instant-hit weapons, slow moving projectiles with fierce power, inaccurate but fierce automatic weapons, continuous-stream energy weapons, sniper rifles, sticky grenade launchers, and even moving, intelligent mines that can be redirected by the player with a laser.

It's colorful, enjoyeable, open to modding, and perhaps the single best shooter of the last decade, even if it wasn't the most influential.

Get this cheap, and you'll enjoy a great set of multiplayer-based levels; built up from UT2003, UT2004 simply is that much of an expansion as to make the original actually pretty worthless.

The campaign's bots are actually reasonablly fun except in the dreaded "football-like" mode, and prove a challenge if the difficulty is boosted up. I re-brought this game just for that - it's fast, frantic and satisfying, and most levels are team based with you in command of who you choose to take into battle (only the very start and end are solo).

Online was amazing when released, and now still lives on. Large maps with vehicles down to small CTF and point control maps are available. After a few years more weapons and maps were added, the majority having respectful bot support. Assault as a game type also is more fun then people care to suggest - not as competitive but great to play :)

I just wish that Unreal Tournament 3 was as half as fun as this was and still is!

966327.review:
Possibly the best FPS I've ever played. As the name would suggest, realism is kept to a minimum and it's all about the action. Your character can dodge jump, double jump, use a translocator to jump around the level really fast. Your weapons are equally unrealistic and therefore fun. It supports a wide array of game modes from Deathmatch, to CTF, to Vehicle attack the enemy base, and more. It's also got over 80 professional quality custom maps that can be downloaded for free on the internet.

While it has full bot support, it's best played with other people, and while it's not the most played game in the world anymore, it's still played by some.

The free demo is cross-compatible with the main game, meaning you can join a demo server and play with players playing the free version.

L'ottimo level design delle nuove mappe aggiunge nuovi spunti sia alla giocabilità generale del titolo che alla notevole bellezza visiva.Questo UT 2004 non si è rivelato un semplice up-grade, come molti si aspettavano, ma è dotato di una propria anima, grazie anche alle numerose aggiunte inserite dai programmatori. 39861565.review:
[h1]Unreal Tournament 2004  - лично для меня является лучшей частью в серии и одним из лучших олдскульных шутеров в истории.[/h1]
Знакомство с этой игрой у меня произошло в 8 лет, когда я впервые пошёл в компьютерный клуб.Там же я впервые поиграл в Serious Sam,DOOM,QUAKE и т.п шутеры, ведь в подобных клубах столь динамичные, экшоновые и драйвовые шутеры ценились на весь золота.
Данная часть серии лично для меня является лучшей, это обусловлено отличной на тот момент графикой,огромным выбором карт и режимов, а самое главное оригинальным и колоритным геймплеем, хоть он и схож в чем-то с Quake, но ощущается совсем по-другому)Также в игре присутсвуют идеально сбалансированные карты, ещё большее разнообразие в оружии относительно предыдущих частей и ХЭВИ МЕТАЛ, идеально подходящий под яростный геймплей игры.Доработана система подбора союзников в команду и турнир в целом.
[h1]Итог:[/h1] 
Unreal Tournament 2004 является диковинкой среди многих шутеров от первого лица, тем более для того времени.Она для меня стоит на лидирующих позициях в данном жанре вместе с вышеупомянутыми DOOM и Quake.В игру приятно вернуться даже в 2018 году, движок Unreal никогда не устареет)

39860789.review:
The best arena shooter of all time.

Combined with one of the best communities and user-created content of all time. Here's a short list of some of my favorite maps:

DM-Redkin
DM-CBP2-Tydal (make sure to check out all the Community Bonus Packs)
DM-UCMP4-Mania
DM-LastCrusader2k4

and many more, comment if you want some more recommendations. But definitely start with those, I think they are still available on mapraider. I got them all there a couple years back and donated to the site so hopefully they are still there. PM me if they're not. 

Utterly fantastic game, can't believe I'm still playing it in 2018 in widescreen (there is a mutator fix for widescreen 1920x1080 monitors since the game was made in 2004, google it) and at 144 fps. Just an excellent package, fantastic AI and bots that are fun to play with, and even local-server mods like UTServer that makes offline multiplayer with rounds and such very realistic to play on your favorite maps, that you would never be able to find a real server and players with. 

They made this game to last. I highly recommend it.
